How will I help?
The Customer Information Management (CIM) team is responsible for leading the way forward in the development our customer centric capabilities. As CIM’s role within the data management of Westpac’s customer data evolves new capabilities will be implemented.  We are continually looking for new and improved ways of doing things Additionally, you will investigate and analyse business problems or opportunities and design future data management requirements, processes and capabilities.
What you will do
Annual validation and maintenance of operational processes and procedures to meet our compliance obligations.
Liaise with key stakeholders such as business units, financial crime, ISG, assurance and project teams
Review and approve changes to the CIM owned applications.
Ensure adherence to the enterprise data governance framework.
Profiling of data and analysis of data lineage.
Utilise a variety of data sources and associated tools and technical skills, e.g. Oracle OCH, Teradata (xDW), Tableau, etc.
Maintain business procedures and documentation.
Identify and manage project risk and issues affecting the Customer Domain.
Ensure the smooth operations and stability of CIM applications and systems, by running review reports, performing daily checks and setting up new users.
Ensure project implementations go-live without impact to operational processes and customer data.
Define and document what is required for changes to business data processes, policies and systems to achieve business outcomes.
Monitor and triage production issues between business and technology teams.
Adoption of new tools and technologies to better manage customer data. 
Define and document what is required for changes to business data processes, policies and systems to achieve business outcomes. 
What’s in it for me?
Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us. 
What do I need? 
5+ years’ experience in a relevant customer focussed industry (retail or financial services preferred).
Business and data analysis skills.
Proven ability to interact effectively with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Intermediate to advanced skills in Teradata SQL. 
Intermediate to advanced skills in process and control documentation, including flowcharting.
An understanding and experience with regulatory requirements and related controls.
An understanding of audit and assurance concepts and processes.
Experience of business operations within the finance industry.
Experience with SAS, Tableau or Qlikview.
What is it like to work in Westpac?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs. 
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

About the company  Our mission is to provide quality, accessible healthcare for all Australians.    Universal healthcare is a longstanding pillar of Australian society. We passionately believe everyone in Australia has a right to affordable, high quality healthcare, wherever they are, and no matter their financial circumstances.    We are proud to be an industry leader in accessible healthcare with more than 7 million patient visits annually. Our nationwide network of 70+ medical centres and 1000+ health practitioners includes both our largest cities and most remote and at-risk communities. This year alone we aim to administer +1m COVID vaccines to create a healthier Australia.    At ForHealth we are proud that our mission is such an important part of the Australian way of life and of the impact we make every day. We are here to make a difference. Join the mission and one of our local communities.   About the Role We are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Application Support Analyst to support our enterprise applications with a ServiceNow focus across ForHealth Group.    Reporting to the Senior Manager of Enterprise Systems and Data, most of your time will be spend monitoring the applications, analysing, liaising with internal and external stakeholders, and working closely with the business users however you’ll possess the ability to work under pressure with a calm demeanour when systems don’t go to plan.    We have a range of enterprise applications and you’ll work with the rest of the team to support them with your focus being on ServiceNow. Other applications include Salesforce, Dynamics365, our dental and medical PMS’s (Practice Management System), HR systems and related systems.    Your role will also see you working closely with the business users and the broader IT team to resolve 2nd and 3rd level support issues and assess/implement changes to the systems including working with external vendors.    Key Responsibilities  Provide 2nd and 3rd level support to business users and IT support Resolve and troubleshoot outages or major service degradation asap and perform post-incident analysis, this may involve out of hours work Implement minor changes to the systems and work closely with vendors for major changes Monitor and support the applications to ensure continual uninterrupted operation Work with cross-functional business units to implement enhancements Stay current with the applications and technologies and identify upgrades and required changes Monitor trends in the different application areas and advise on new packages, extensions, and possible migration to new platforms – a focus of ours is to move to SaaS or PaaS platforms where practical     About You  Relevant tertiary qualification in computing, or a related computing field and/or relevant industry experience. Basic systems and programming skills. Support of other applications. Experience with Microsoft products and platforms. Ability to work under pressure. Empathy with our internal users and a helping, can-do, attitude. Attention to detail and works to improve the status quo        Benefits   Competitive Pay Opportunities for future career progression and development Diversity in your role with no two days being the same The opportunity to be a part of a team that promotes accessible and affordable healthcare to all Australians     If you are interested in this position and would like to discuss the opportunity in more detail, submit your resume by clicking  “APPLY NOW”

About ahmSimple, easy and affordable. That’s our mission for health insurance.We take a straightforward approach to creating positive experiences for our customers. We work flexibly, and look after our health and wellbeing – it helps us be at our best.If you have passion for driving results, a strategic mindset, and a love of innovation, now is the time to join ahm.  About the role As Digital Insights Analyst you’ll be the go-to for providing a clear and comprehensive analysis of web performance across both private health insurance and diversified product portfolios. Reporting to the Analytics Manager, you are happy to roll up your sleeves to: Provide oversight of performance against set KPIs and uncover trends in data that help support insight development in line with the processes undertaken by the digital design and delivery teams. Ensure that GA360 is set up in a way that helps effectively measure the performance of both upstream and downstream prospect and member activities. Provide technical support in line with ensuring accurate measurement, supporting all tagging and GA360 integrations. Provide data/self-serve reporting in the form of dashboarding, to internal stakeholders within marketing, as well as agency partners for them to develop performance marketing programs that are geared toward continuous improvement against key business KPIs. Reporting in line with the weekly, monthly, and quarterly needs of the business – with a specific focus on supporting the Growth Squad with insight development on the sales side. Focus on CRO support and digital a/b testing by providing a statistically relevant view of performance. Be the point of contact for digital analytics across the ahm business and with external partners. Work closely with New Ventures team to develop experiments and validate hypotheses through the prototyping and prototyping phases of development  Now, who are you? Enough about us, let’s talk about you… you have an entrepreneurial spirit and aren’t afraid to roll your sleeves up when the time comes. You’re a little bit obsessive about understanding our customers and getting to know what makes them tick. You’re a self-starter and can manage competing stakeholders, time, and priorities effectively. You will need: A minimum of 3 years experience in digital analytics and insights performing complex data analysis A strong knowledge of Google Marketing Platform stack, with intermediate knowledge of GA360 and Optimise 360. Experience with Google’s Data Studio and BigQuery tools Experience using Tableau reporting or similar BI dashboarding software. An understanding of the Digital Marketing landscape and measures of success across digital channels including SEM, SEO, Display, Social Media, and Email marketing. Experience with SQL, Redshift(AWS), SAS, and Python desired but not essential [link removed]  A career with usWe know that to make health insurance simpler for all Australians, we need everyone on board. We believe in developing Indigenous careers. And we work hard to create an accessible and inclusive workplace. You can find out more about Medibank’s Accessibility and Inclusion Plan here [link removed] (no, that’s not a typo, Medibank is our big sister brand). If we call you to discuss the role, you'll also get the opportunity to chat about any adjustments you need.  Don’t worry, our approach to flexibility means virtual interviews won’t impact your application. All employees who may attend a worksite or any face-to-face work-related activity will be required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of employment. To start small and impact bigger.

Marketing Data Analyst

Permanent role
Flexible location

About the role
The Marketing Science Analyst should help shape strategic marketing agenda by supporting the Marketing Science Lead and Marketing Science Operations Lead in generating and delivering insightful analysis highlighting potential opportunities to deliver growth, maximise ROI and connect marketing performance with business outcomes.
The Marketing Science Analyst will play a key role across the marketing science value chain in processing data for analysis, building models, and creating presentations that communicate impactful insights and putting forward actionable recommendations to marketing stakeholders.
Key Duties

Development of innovative and proactive marketing performance insights using expertise in data mining and analysis tools.
Unify analytics with business acumen to partner with internal stakeholders to work through challenging marketing planning decisions and unique business questions
Responsible for developing models and tools, identifying and creating models to help understand, monitor, and predict marketing outcomes. Eg. Make and optimize budget, channel and media mix decisions, understand the impact of a marketing activity on sales, forecast the impact of budgeting, brand and competitor activity on business outcomes.
Harmonise, process, and analyse data to develop presentations which address marketing & business challenges
Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines
Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of solving complex business problems. Collaborate with internal & external partners to help develop new tools and capabilities
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key management groups particularly Technology, Customer & Market Insights, Finance and Portfolio teams.  
Support the maintenance and improvement of processes used to collect, retrieve, and interpret data.
Handle large and complex marketing data using different applications.
You will be expected to work closely with marketing teams to help them understand the impact of decisions on potential results and to generate unique insights that ‘solve the puzzle’ of what drives performance.
Establish strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders and agencies identifying shared goals, removing blockages, and enabling collaboration.
Manage stakeholder expectations and act as an advocate for marketing science practices.

About You

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Actuarial Studies, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)
1-2 years of experience with marketing mix modelling, digital media analysis, business focused analytics, advertising effectiveness analysis, quantitative market research or other related client insights experience.
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel; other tools such as SQL & R a plus but not required.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience working independently to identify themes across data points and the ability to communicate a story with the data.
Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics.
An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions.
The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally.
Strong verbal and written communication skills suitable for audiences all at levels of the business (Brand Managers, EGMs, CEOs, Board).

Technical Competencies

Graduate in marketing or computer science
Strong numeracy and analytical skills
Demonstrated experience using data mining tools
Passion for data interpretation and optimisation
Experience with relational databases and analysing large quantities of marketing data
Exposure to Dashboard development desired
Team player, creative and passionate
Ability to multi-task while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail and organization
Outstanding presentation and communication skills
Comfort dealing with large amounts of data on a regular basis
Evidence of using and applying data to aid decision making and analysis
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast-changing environment
Demonstrated ability to work independently in processing data and communicating insights.
Experience with tag management platforms, Excel, APIs, etc. will be highly regarded.

partnering with the marketing team as a specialist in the campaign development process
analysing the results of campaigns and other strategic marketing activities
build scripts and tools to automate analytical and reporting processes


Process large volumes of data of various data sources
Hands-on use of R and Python (or other programming languages) and our big data platform

Experience processing data using SQL in a Data Warehouse or similar environment

Job Title: Business Systems and Data Analyst - Brisbane
Description: About the RoleThe purpose of the Business Systems and Data Analyst role is to enhance business systems usage to extract more value and provide ease of use; and to facilitate effective data governance and reporting to support accurate business decisions.The role responsibilities include: Improve business value of IT systems by working with business managers and IT support teams to enhance core business systems and their data repositories, including Salesforce, Atlassian Confluence and Jira, and Microsoft SharePoint. Work collaboratively with business managers and executives to determine data analytics and dashboard requirements. Support quantitative data analysis by administering data analytical platforms (PowerBI, Salesforce reporting etc.) and providing data catalogues, user training, report templates and default system connectors/integrations. Define and administer a metadata schema within SharePoint Online to increase searchability and support data classifications. Ensure data and business systems adhere to security policies and procedures. Ensure core business systems (including SharePoint, Teams, Atlassian, S/4Hana and Salesforce) have defined, documented and communicated governance standards aligned to best practice and nationally recognised security frameworks. Assist with minimising administrative effort across the business using process automation. Develop and maintain a “Champion” program providing key staff with training and expertise to accelerate the uptake and value of core systems. Analyse system data sources (AD, Azure, SaaS, etc.) to ensure consistency and improve IT Governance and functional excellence. Assist other South Asia Esri distributors with aligning on business and data systems and policies.  About You A minimum of three years’ experience in business systems administration and data governance within similar environments. Experience with programming languages such as Python, PowerShell, T-SQL and Apex. Experience with industry-standard security governance frameworks (e.g., NIST CSF, ISO 27001, ISM, COBIT or Essential Eight). Keen interest in business technology, including self-education and keeping up to date with industry changes. Strong interpersonal / client engagement skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Highly motivated and proactive. Strong attention to detail and accuracy when accomplishing a task. The ability to prioritise workloads, manage time and schedule tasks whilst remaining resilient to changing priorities. Advocating for, and experience in presenting data-driven information. Understanding of ITIL aligned business processes, including best practice organisational data flows. The ability to foster teamwork and promote a positive and inclusive workplace experience, in-office and online. Demonstrated alignment with Esri Australia's core values. Tertiary qualification in an associated business discipline (Information Technology, Data Analytics etc.) is highly desirable. Accreditations and Certifications in related disciplines is highly regarded (Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate or Cloud vendor security certifications: Microsoft Azure Data Scientist Associate or AWS Certified Big Data) You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia. Personality/behaviour aligns to Esri Australia’s core values.  For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Tibo Torche, National Talent Acquisition Lead on 07 3218 0448 or mail to ttorche@esriaustralia.com.au. We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

The Company Our client is a highly regarded, nationwide manufacturing organisation, with a range of products in the automotive aftermarket and automotive accessories - who pride themselves on creating and maintaining outstanding customer relationships. Currently the business employs over 650 staff across Australia, New Zealand and Thailand.  Our client is going through significant growth and is seeking a Data & Sales Analyst to assist the wider sales, product, and marketing teams, reporting into the GM of Sales & Marketing. The role Your remit is to lead the design of key data analysis and trend analysis in line with global sales. Your recommendations will be heard as you develop insights that will be used to execute and plan product performance and probability in the market. You will conduct regular sales reporting, manage the entire budgeting/ forecasting process and lead the customer/ category management. You will work closely with the Sales, Marketing, Product and Finance teams to create sales modelling, pricing and logistics’ sphere’s to help drive key decisions. Skills & Experience You are an expert with numbers, passionate about data and enjoy using numbers to push decisions, helping formulate a story.  Identifying external opportunities to enhance product development/ performance sit well into your capability toolkit, you enjoy being a subject matter expert and advising line management on how to drive data decisions that impact the business.  You are a proven performer in a data/ sales analyst or category role, and it is time for your next challenge.  You are system savvy; an excel whiz with experience using SAP/ Phocas BI Your expertise is creating trend analysis and forecasting and how they can impact the business, your ability to engage stakeholders at all levels and present in an engaging and informed way will see you gain business credibility and traction. For More Information Forward your application detailing why this role is perfect for you for the attention of Juliette Noone, Consultant at Miller Leith. For a brief, confidential discussion about this role or your next career move, please contact juliette@millerleith.com.au or 0411 945 522.

About the ABSWe are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers. About the roles These are multiple permanent APS5 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.  As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities. You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.  You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator. View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – SSG Recruitment Video - YouTube DutiesYour responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:analysing data for input into statistical compilation and data validation, including using alternative data sourcescommunicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights compiling and publishing statistical products, with a strong focus on continuous improvement applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions  We are seeking people who have: strong conceptual, analytical, and creative skillsprevious work experience in a data or statistical roleexperience working in and contributing to a high performing teamgood oral and written communication skills, and can present and engage with clients/ stakeholdersDesirable (but not essential) are:experience supervising staff, and supporting staff developmentacademic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative componentBenefitsAnnual salary increases Hybrid working (office and work from home)Inclusion and diversity networks Access to mentors and coaches Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)  Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

Our client, the NSW Department of Education are seeking a Database Analyst to join their Centre for Education Statistics Evaluation. Within this role you would support the sourcing and provision of education information for release to internal and external stakeholders in a manner consistent with open data and other information government policies.   Role: Database Analyst.  Contract Length: 3 months. ASAP start required.  Rate: $550 + Super. Location: Parramatta with some WFH flexibility.  The role:Conduct research, prepare reports or formulate plans to address economic problems related to the production and distribution of goods/ services, as well as monetary and fiscal policy.Collect and process economic and statistical data using sampling techniques and econometric methods.Monitor, manage and report on requests for data and other information from internal and external stakeholders and consumers of data services.Liaise with others in the organization around publications produced and circulate for review and input from data stewards and data owners.Ensure proactive communication occure with key internal/external stakeholders, data owners and consumers of data services to facilitate exchange of information.Maintain the NSW Education Data Hub by coordinating data and apporvals form stewards and owners. Challenges:Providing accurate and timely data and analysis to ensure that consumers of data services have available information to make decisions and improve outcomes.Manage competing priorities, within agreed timeframes and to a required standard.Manage the expectations of internal/external stakeholders and consumers of data services while also providing high levels of service and support in information exchange. About You:Can operate independently in performing core work functions.Consults with the manager - Data Services on matters that are sensitive/contentious to agree on ways forward.Acts with a high level of integrity, as well as displaying an excellent commitment to customer service.Candidates must be Sydney based and prepared to get a WWCC. If you feel this opportunity matches your skills and previous experiences, please apply with your CV.

Senior BI Analyst Objective of the position  This is a newly created role to accelerate the maturity and adoption of Business Intelligence across a the entire enterprise environment as part of a center of excellence.  Responsibilities  Analysis and end - to - end delivery of of new data process/ documentation and functionality of the MS Power platform.  Work closely with SME's to test reporting deliverables accuracy, ensure business value is realised.  Remain up to date with the latest functionalities and updates with the MS Power stack.   Selection Criteria  Strong technical capabilities in SQL and MS Power Platform. Agile delivery.  Previous experience in a BI center of excellence in an enterprise environment.    What Is On Offer This organisation has a proven leading career development program with a diverse leadership team dedicated to mentoring at all levels within the technology function. Annual bonus scheme based on personal achievement and salary's that align with the fast changing technology sector. Contact Glenn at glenn@capstonerecruitment.com.au for more information.

Our client, a company that specialises in delivering modern Point of Sale technology solutions for franchise brands and multi-site retailers, is currently seeking the expertise of an SQL Developer to join their team. Essential experienceKnowledge of the Microsoft stack (SSRS, SSIS & SSAS)Experience with Webservices/APIsExperience with LINQ, T-SQL, Stored Procedures, SQL optimisation and relational database design experience.Comfortable using Visual StudioDesirable experienceKnowledge of .NET CoreCloud experience with Azure Knowledge in HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript using libraries such as JQuery SVN source code management.Benefits of working for this company9-day fortnightWhen the hybrid working conditions start; beautiful Pyrmont office locationThis company is not expecting "blood from a stone"Work for a highly regarded company (according to the reputable Glasshouse). To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Jennifer Bohm on 02 9464 5518 or email: jbohm@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

Permanent fulltime position | Full Remote Work Available Competitive Salary & Company Benefits Join a progressive global family-owned business   We are currently searching for an experienced Data Analyst to join our Data Systems team. You will be responsible for supporting the Kelley Blue Book Vehicle Catalogue that Cox Automotive Australia use to provide valuations to products across the ecosystem and be responsible for determining the valuation of used and new vehicles. You will analyse transaction data, correlate the forecast model output with market trends, update the forecast via the VIMS application and collaborate with the Kelley Blue Book Analytics Team and others as required.   About your new role:  Keep current on trends, market conditions, product development, and other information related to new and used vehicles Report valuation trends to management via reports and presentations Assist with and perform ad hoc analysis for all relevant departments and senior management. Meet with representatives from automotive manufacturers, financial institutions, and dealers. This includes attending industry events such as seminars and product meetings. Management of vehicle catalog data used in the market  Review vehicle description and adjust as necessary (Model, Version, category/body style, segment/sub-segment/price curve/vehicle map/lead vehicle, classification (passenger/fleet/commercial) Determine whether a vehicle should be published (set Do Not Publish flags) Determine which vehicles need to be created as new model at year end   Support data mapping quality  Review unmapped or low mapping score matches and provide correct matches to improve matching quality internally & externally (HIS market)   Review and update valuation portfolio  Review forecast output every production cycle and make adjustments before publish Each value type should be reviewed – trade-in, auction, private party & TDA Review price gaps & lead to non-lead relationships Manage trade-in & private party calculation   Work with International Data Science team to optimize valuation algorithm  Provide feedback on forecast quality every production cycle Review proposed optimizations output and provide feedback   Evaluate feedback from internal users & customers on valuation quality   What do we need from you?  Experience in a similar role in a medium to large organisation or significant equivalent experience in a related industry  Exposure to working in the automotive industry  Exemplary written and verbal communication skills  Strong decision-making skills  Ability to study, analyse and interpret complex activities and/or information in order to improve new practices or develop new approaches  Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint  Exposure to working in the automotive industry highly regarded  Ability to write and understand SQL queries would be beneficial but not essential   Why Cox Automotive Australia?  High growth global family-owned business Great team with a strong culture of support & inclusiveness Competitive salary package with flexible working arrangements Access to Cox Automotive Australia’s EAP (Employee Assistance Program) Birthday & volunteer leave Discounts on travel, fitness and more   If you have a positive attitude and the right credentials, please apply now to join the Cox Automotive team and make your mark!

This is a contract role focused on the strategic design of a modelling solution, to build new more efficient analyses models to be used by the Pricing Team for experience analysis.  The key part of the role is to combine a range of technologies in the most optimal way to translate existing Excel models into new tools to enhance business processes, reduce risk and develop state-of-the-art analytics and data science solutions.  The Insurance design team work on an integrated approach, leveraging insights across claims, underwriting, product and pricing to ensure best practice outcomes for members.  You will be:   Responsible for co-designing an end to end experience analysis process which will result in increased automation and improved efficiencies Work closely with business stakeholders to determine the most appropriate selection of software/tools to use for each aspect of the process, including data checking and cleaning, analysis of experience, and visualization of results. Assess and scope requirements for converting models from Excel into the selected technology, (e.g. SQL, Python, PowerBI), including design, development, coding, test, ensure fit for purpose and document. Provide expertise and understanding of all pricing factors relating to insurance principles Leverage insights across claims, underwriting, product, and pricing Establish and maintain mutually supportive, consistent, and transparent relationships with stakeholders across the business.  You will bring with you:   Significant experience in a life insurance pricing team Advanced Excel skills and highly proficient in Python, SQL, Git, and PowerBI Experience with data retrieval, cleaning and modelling, quant analysis and visualisation Proven track record in developing and delivering best practice data science solutions, solving analytical problems holistically through quant approaches, with a pragmatic approach to technology Attention to detail, judgment, critical thinking, and decision making Ability to work with large data sets, identify drivers and develop appropriate strategies Ability to liaise, influence, and engage with a range of stakeholders Highly developed verbal, written, presentation, and persuasion skills  Ideally, the role is based in Brisbane, however, highly experienced candidates who reside elsewhere will be considered.  For more information please contact Lesley.traverso@talentinsights.com.au, 0433 129390You must be currently in Australia with a valid visa to apply.

multiple_details: Enjoy a Flexi Day on us!
Description:
From nation-defining races to world-class media that transports our customers trackside, creating awesome experiences is what we live for. As part of our wagering and media team, you’ll help create excitement in the contest like no one else.
 
The Wagering & Media (W&M) technology function is a business facing domain that predominately works with the Wagering & Media business units to achieve their business strategy, enabling them to deliver superb customer experiences, differentiating for competitive advantage, and driving growth, innovation, and value for the W&M business. The W&M technology team is required to continuously improve products and services and execute the defined technology strategy via delivery of prioritised technology initiatives.
 
Your role is expected to understand the business’ strategies and objectives, the predictive business issues to be solved, and contribute to the determination what individual or linked wagering datasets and machine learning tools and algorithms can be used to best solve these issues and be hands-on in solving these issues with predictive tools.
 
The Data Science team is tasked with balancing business insight, acumen, and analytics to develop insights that informs business thinking and develops intellectual property to move the business forward.
 
What you’ll do
 

You will be an individual and team contributor- working on building data science platforms, products, and solutions from the ground-up as well as researching ways to improve the business
Take practical, real-world problems and opportunities and solve them with machine learning processes that drive measurable improvements in business performance and outcomes
Collaborate with internal SMEs, data analysts and data architects, to create predictive analytics products
Support the day to day running of our data science platform and processes
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and present results in a clear manner

What you’ll bring
Qualifications

Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Quantitative Science

Experience

2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / Associate Data Scientist in a corporate environment building and delivering data science products and solutions especially in applying Machine Learning techniques, advanced analytics, and statistical modelling
Experience with the R / Python programming language
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Tableau
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL
Experience with cloud-based data environments
Good, applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills
Strong background in foundational mathematics such as statistics, probability, and linear algebra
A business mindset - you ask and address the most important analytical questions with a view on enhancing product impact
Passionate and attentive self-starter, great communicator, and amazing follow-through - you love the responsibility of being personally empowered
Start-up mentality (fast-paced, flexible, and team-oriented)
Demonstrated ability to apply data science techniques in business environments

Proven ability to get things done under uncertainty
About Tabcorp
Looking for your next challenge? We’re looking for technologists who love to solve complex problems and influence and shape the future. 
At Tabcorp we manage iconic Australian brands which ignite passion and excitement in millions of Australians. Our purpose is "Excitement with Integrity", and we pride ourselves on creating awesome, life-changing moments.
At our heart is our customers and community, our people, and our technology.  Last year we contributed over $4.5B to the Australian community.  We’ve been through a transformation and are focused on the future, adopting new technologies and building future capability.
We have an opportunity for resilient and curious technologists to grow their career at Tabcorp and have some fun and excitement along the way.
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au
COVID-19
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment.

The role involves data and analytics to inform the design of the market and the development of policies.
 
This role works hands-on to drive the design and management of market framework. The team has significant control of the end-to-end data and analytics infrastructure stack, with endless opportunities.
 Key accountabilities


Delivery of business analytics, business intelligence and ad-hoc analysis.
Design and implementation of dataflows and data automation processes to support development of a single source of truth datawarehouse.
Building, updating and amending of tables, views and datamarts,
Automation of data management and data quality processes, including development of data standards, procedures and definitions.
Change management and impact assessment of data quality and provision from upstream systems changes.
Actively identify and implement improvements to the sourcing and accuracy of data.

 Responsibilities


Delivering sophisticated analysis and projects to integrate information and adapt in an unpredictable environment
Providing clear analytical advice using multiple sources of data.
Act independently with regards to data analysis and solving problems 
Consult with senior officers in relation to decisions that have resource implications, are contentious and /or are likely to have an impact on stakeholders.


 On offer is a long term contract with a large government group. Submissions close very shortly.

Permanent opportunityPerth based NV1/ Baseline / Australian Citizen About the company:Green Light is one of Australia's most successful and fastest-growing IT services businesses. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure, and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand, SE Asia, and Europe. About the engagement:Green Light are looking for a Junior and Senior Data Analyst to join our client for an upcoming project. Location – Subiaco / Rockingham  The RoleThe Data Analyst role involves working at the customer site alongside a senior member of our client’s team. You will represent the customer and as a result will gain valuable insight into how our customer conducts Engineering Changes, Configuration Management, Asset Management and Sustainment activities, plus many other aspects of their business.  To be successful in this role you will need strong interpersonal skills, team orientated, a keen eye for detail and the curiosity to find out why things are failing, how they can be resolved and how can the customers get more benefit to their business from our solutions. Essential Requirements To be considered for this role you must hold Australian Citizenship and have the following skills:  Exceptional written and oral communication skillsProven problem-solving abilities including articulating & formal documentation of solutionsMotivation and willingness to learn and receive mentoring and guidanceAbility to effectively manage time to reach outcomes within deadlinesSQL Server / Oracle & Data Warehouse ConceptsTeam-oriented, structured working style combined with good, communication and presentation skillsAble to disseminate information to all levels in a clear and concise manner utilising good written, verbal and computer skillsLearn and embrace new technologies and openly seek advice from others when unsure of approach or technologyPractical experience in agile software development or product lifecycle managementExpert knowledge in the Asset Management and Planning System application used by the RANApplicants must be willing to undergo a security clearancePractical experience in agile software development or product lifecycle management  Desirable Requirements Customer facing experience and the confidence and ability to communicate at all levelsAn existing Baseline security is advantageousExposure to any of the following: Salesforce, SAP & PegaPLM and Industry 4.0, IoT, Digital Twin, AI and Machine LearningPreference given to Defence or ex-Defence Force candidates.  How to Apply:Click APPLY or contact Jaya Aidasani (jayaa@greenlightworldwide.com)– Senior Resource Manager for a confidential discussion with Green Light Worldwide.

Canstar is Australia’s biggest financial comparison website. For over 25 years, Canstar has been researching and rating financial and consumer products. We employ over 150 staff with a diverse range of educational and professional backgrounds. We take pride in the cultural and gender diversity of our staff and our ability to offer our people the opportunity to grow and develop their skills as the company grows too. The Insights team plays a key role in Canstar’s communication strategy by ensuring we are first to market with compelling news stories that are data-driven, topical and well researched. Data Insights Analysts are responsible for creating new and innovative ways to analyse data, and find stories in research. Data Insights Analysts regularly access market and consumer data and surveys, analyse trends, write summaries and assist with media enquiries.  We are looking for a Casual Data Insights Analyst, offering 2 days per week, who will assist the Insights Team with media-related data requests. In this role, you will assist the team in providing topical, timely, data-driven insights that inform our consumers. What Canstar Offers:  Supportive and flexible working environment Birthday leave Employee Assistance Program Health & wellbeing program of benefits Fun social club and company culture Training and development opportunities in areas that matter to you  What You Will Be Doing:  Work closely with the Data Insights Analyst and Data Insights Manager to respond to diverse media requests Run comparisons and calculations and transform data into convincing stories Run regular data-based market reports Participate in brainstorms for insight story ideas Develop a generalist knowledge of our key product verticals  What You Need To Bring To The Role:  Currently studying in a relevant degree in Finance, Marketing, Journalism, Economics, Commerce or related discipline Experience with performing a range of calculations in Excel Great with words and numbers Thrive in a fast-paced working environment  What Will Give You The Extra Edge:   Understanding of or passion for financial products Experience using Excel Power Query Experience using Tableau  How Can You Join The Team: If this sounds like you, and you are up for a fresh challenge with a great company, please click apply now and ensure that your CV and cover letter has been uploaded to your profile. Recruitment Agencies: We politely ask that you refrain from contacting our People & Culture team or hiring managers directly. Canstar does not accept any unsolicited referrals from recruitment or job placement agencies.

We are scaling up! An exciting opportunity exists for a Data Scientist to join the innovative and successful FinTech team at Fundo Loans, based in Surry Hills.  Why Join Us? Competitive remuneration - be recognised for your experience and skillsAwesome career progression opportunities - make your mark and find fulfillment in a rapidly growing business committed to being better each dayFlexible work environment - be supported with flexible working conditions dedicated to achieving a good work/life balanceNew, light-filled and centrally located office space -  5 mins walk from Central station + surrounded by a vibrant bar and restaurant sceneStrong team culture - be encouraged to develop professionally and personally in a social, supportive and dynamic environment About UsFundo Loans was born in 2015. Our first year revenue was $400,000 - this year will be over $40 Million dollars. We grew our revenue by 996% in 2020 alone, and 250% in 2021. We now have a large scale, off-shore customer service team as well as tech-devs with a small executive tech team here in Sydney. We're dedicated to creating an environment of growth and fulfilment through conquering challenges, and we want you on board for the ride. Job OverviewWe are looking for a Data Scientist who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.Responsibilities:Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.Qualifications for Data Scientist:Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.Experience working with and creating data architectures.Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.We’re looking for someone with 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, and is familiar with the following software/tools:Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.Deployed at least 4+ models in productions used by businesses.Experience using web services: AWS, Google Cloud.Proven Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders.

We’re looking to scale our paid channels in 2022, combining increased paid media spend with tailored post-click journeys that drive conversion into our product. This is an exciting opportunity to own our most important source of demand generation.About the role: You will set the strategy and manage digital campaigns for Coassemble including but not limited to Affiliate, Display, Paid Search, Paid Social, Retargeting. Test, track and report on key campaign results and continually identify opportunities for improvement.Expand into new digital channels, platforms, audiences and content through testing.Build upon current channel analytics to track and report performance, including budget tracking and forecasting across paid channels.Present performance results and insights to the wider team on a weekly basis. Understanding of the technical setup required to track paid media success.Ability to look beyond the click and build relevant journeys that convert traffic into leads.What are we looking for from you? At least 3 years working experience in media managing campaigns across marketing platforms such as Facebook, Google Ads, Bing etc.Experience in lead generation or other conversion-focused landscape working towards a CPL (either client or agency side) Experience working with B2B or SaaS companies or clients. You will be driven by data. You will need to be comfortable tracking, measuring and gaining insights from data to understand your impact and optimise.We need a team player. You will need to collaborate across multiple teams; marketing, product, sales, support.Have a solid understanding of the industry and competitive landscape.What are some of the sweet perks we offer? Genuine focus on work/life balance. Flexible work arrangements. Opportunity for personal growth and development. Generous parental leave.Quarterly team social events. 6 weeks annual leave. One of Australia’s fastest growing tech companies. If you are a highly energetic and passionate Paid Media Specialist seeking both a rewarding and challenging opportunity with a fast growing SaaS company, then we want to hear from you! Coassemble is filled with talented and passionate individuals, have a sneak peek at our Careers page and website to check out our awesome team and culture https://coassemble.com/careers  If you have any questions about the role, please feel free to reach out to Dimity Redcliffe (Head of Operations) at dimity@coassemble.com

Alongside Woolworths Supermarkets, we’ve helped make online shopping simpler and more intuitive, and were awarded #1 in customer satisfaction for online groceries by Canstar for our combined effort. The success of our entire business is because of our people. Diversity is our strength, through the potential we unlock together. You will have worked across multiple squads and are highly experienced in liaising with key business stakeholders, understanding and validating system requirements, documenting user stories, test & acceptance criteria and also assisting with the testing of deliverables. In this role you will  Actively participate in all phases of the project including analysis, design, development, testing, user training, change management and implementation. Write requirements and user stories that are succinct and have the relevant detail to ensure the velocity of the team is kept at a maximum Move legacy codes from DB's Stored Procedures & SSIS into newer technologies using event steams and microservices Work together with engineering squads and other BA's to achieve alignment and highlight issues to PO's when applicable Participate in all agile ceremonies and on some occasions facilitate agile ceremonies, remove blockers and perform some other tasks typically aligned to a scrum master from time to time Run Workshops when required for new initiatives or decision points  About youThe successful candidate will need to demonstrate strong technical knowledge and understanding, as well as solid stakeholder engagement skills with an effective ability to build relationships across the organisation. You must exhibit your capability to work cross-functionally and influence both the delivery team and the business in meeting objectives.  Strong communication skills - able to communicate effectively key messages with stakeholders, have an adaptive style and influence outcomes. Knowledge management and transition to BAU of business process Ability to translate technical concepts to business concepts, and vice versa Will have worked on Technology uplift projects in the past. Succinct system mapping skills to depict AS and TO BE of solutions and proposals Experience working in agile delivery environment Familiarity with the capabilities and applications of a range of reporting and analytical tools  Ability to step up when required as the project develops and require additional support You will be able to prioritise your workload whilst working in a fast paced environment  What's in it for you An attractive remuneration package Opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our Team Members  If you meet a number of requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application. Civic Centre - NunawadingFixed Term Full TimeBand 8 ($109,245 - $121,522 p/a) + 10% Super18 Month Full Time Fixed Term ContractDo you just love seeing systems talk seamlessly and securely with other to drive customer experience and operational efficiency? Look no further - assist our Transformation on the ERP implementation project.Located 15 kilometres east of Melbourne’s CBD, the City of Whitehorse is a culturally diverse major hub of cultural, commercial, business and innovative activity in the eastern suburbs of Melbourne. Its almost 179,000 residents live in the suburbs of Blackburn, Blackburn North, Blackburn South, Box Hill, Box Hill North, Box Hill South, Burwood, Burwood East, Forest Hill, Mitcham, Mont Albert, Mont Albert North, Nunawading, Surrey Hills, Vermont and Vermont South. At Whitehorse City Council, community is at the heart of everything we do. To stay ahead of the evolving changes and needs of the community, the organisation is undertaking an exciting transformation journey that will transform ways of working and will empower employees to be innovative and constantly striving towards providing excellent customer experience at all times. The five pillars of our transformation focus on:Excellent Customer Experience and Service DeliveryGreat Organisational CultureInnovation and Continuous ImprovementGood Governance and IntegrityLong Term Financial SustainabilityThe role:This position is responsible for deploying, designing and implementing processes and application configurations to efficiently integrate data exchanges, both project related and BAU, between legacy cloud and on-premise applications and web services to the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. By working closely with and supporting Council SMEs and stakeholders, the role considers and documents both customer and business requirements to deliver secure, automated, standardised and synchronised data exchanges between applications.About you:As the ERP Application Integration Data Analyst at Whitehorse City Council you will: Ensure that application integration activities contribute to the successful delivery of customer focussed ERP solutions that align with the wider Technology Transformation.Support the achievement of Council’s ERP objectives and partner with stakeholders and ERP project members to understand and implement application integration solutions to the new ERP platform, enabling core systems and the web services that surface this data to ensure reliable, on demand information provision.Plan and deploy key application integration solutions that that align with WCC’s enterprise architecture standards, best practice and continuous improvement methodologies.Where applicable, lead user acceptance testing and guide training to ensure the quality of the solution and ensure smooth execution and operation To be successful in the role you will have: Relevant tertiary qualification in the area of Information Technology, Application or Data Analysis or similar.Demonstrated experience successfully applying Application or Data Analysis to deliver positive, customer focussed outcome in the technology, software, or digital sphere.Detailed knowledge of ICT trends, issues and opportunities particularly those related to ERP, digital and online services and working with stakeholders and business teams to understand current application dependencies, identify opportunities and use technology to shape value adding new solutions.A blend of IT application and data analysis and technical applications administration skills applied successfully in large complex organisations.Excellent organisation, written and verbal communication skills with the ability to produce high quality, actionable workflow solution plans and reports, and make formal presentations to stakeholders and organisational forums.Further information is available from Mark Ackland, Manager Digital and Business Technology on 0409 04 0838. Applications must address the key selection criteria listed in the position description. Applications close Sunday 13 February 2022. The successful candidate must provide evidence of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Enquiries: Mark AcklandPh: 0409040838Applications Close: 13/02/2022To view the position description or submit your application please click the 'Apply Now' button below.

Job Title: Data Engineer (SQL, Python, AWS) - Streaming Media - Hot New ROLE $140k
Description: Well, listen up folks, we have a winner … OK, so everywhere you look at the moment, we’re being told that the world is changing and that life and business will never be the same, WELL I have some good news, Big Wave Digital is THRILLED to be working on a BRAND NEW and LIVE role within the BOOMING Digital Streaming Media Sector. Without going over the top, these guys are actually EXTREMELY BUSY at the moment and as such NEED YOUR HELP. This is an eclectic role and requires a deep understanding of the use of Data, SQL, Python & AWS, so why work here? Streaming Media, VOD, Connected TV, you get the idea, this sector is thriving and content is King OR Queen. Work with interesting and creative individuals who are extremely intelligent BUT not arrogant. Growing Business driven by Data and insights, you won’t be the smartest person in the room! Work with a dynamic, passionate and “idea’s driven by data” culture, this business is booming and we need you to help. So what does our client need from you?  Comprehensive knowledge and nuances of being a Data Engineer Data Management Systems experience Data Files SQL Python AWS Utilising various data sources and being able to extract and analyse that Data Able to derive data-driven strategies that connect BRANDS with our clients audiences. ‘Go-to person’ for questions around data engineering and how it relates to audience Perhaps some experience building dashboards, visual and otherwise. Understanding of DATA collection methodologies Robust reports in place to identify issues with data This is a data driven role, you will be passionate about everything DATA related Ablily to turn data-sets into STORY Led insights   So let’s talk about YOU! Our client would like you to have:-  A keen interest in streaming media, VOD, Connected TV and the role of digital in a new connected world, and a strong desire to be a part of that! Ideally you would have a wealth of experience working in a Data Analytics business or services, analytics and/or a digital media agency. Or a client side role. You’ll be interested in Data, what it means and what you can do with it. You have demonstrative experience in Data and using it . You understand the fundamentals of addressable media and the application of data into advertising, marketing & product programs You have excellent communication skills, and love working in a collaborative and VIBRANT environment.  So please reach out to me for a confidential conversation as this role is HOT TO TROT. Contact Keiran Hathorn, Head of Digital & Data Big Wave Digital keiran@bigwavedigital.com.au

About the ABSWe are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers. About the roles These are multiple permanent APS5 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.  As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities. You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.  You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator. View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – SSG Recruitment Video - YouTube DutiesYour responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:analysing data for input into statistical compilation and data validation, including using alternative data sourcescommunicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights compiling and publishing statistical products, with a strong focus on continuous improvement applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions  We are seeking people who have: strong conceptual, analytical, and creative skillsprevious work experience in a data or statistical roleexperience working in and contributing to a high performing teamgood oral and written communication skills, and can present and engage with clients/ stakeholdersDesirable (but not essential) are:experience supervising staff, and supporting staff developmentacademic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative componentBenefitsAnnual salary increases Hybrid working (office and work from home)Inclusion and diversity networks Access to mentors and coaches Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)  Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

Job Title: Data analyst / engineer - zero emission vehicles
Description: Can you help accelerate the transition to electric vehicles, hydrogen, and greener fleets using your data skills and insights?If so, let's talk. We are a small consultancy with big ideas and a purpose. Our mission is to make transport better for people, better for the environment, and better for the economy. We’re seeking someone special who understands this and can turn it into practical advice for our clients.About you...  You are passionate about sustainability and you can analyse and present data and research in a compelling way to drive decisions. You're interested in cars, trucks, fuels, energy or technology (ideally, a combination).  You may be a data analyst or engineer looking to crunch the numbers to shape the future. Or you might be from another technical area or advisory role with recent experience or knowledge of electric and low emission vehicles.  You must be a clear and convincing communicator, with solid data analysis skills, and an ability to translate the results into high quality reports and presentations. This includes researching and reviewing relevant literature.  The Role... We are a small team so you need to be comfortable doing multiple and diverse tasks, but your core work will be to:  Research public information sources for relevant dataAnalyse, model, and present data in a structured and convincing way for different audiencesDevelop data models to analyse datasets, develop projections, run scenarios, and present data using visual platforms (such as Power BI)Be as comfortable working with dollars as with litres, kilowatts or tonnes CO2Communicate the results and insights from your work (written and verbal)Manage, evaluate, and report on commercial trials of new fuels and technologies (electric, hydrogen, biofuels, etc.)Track and manage projects and deliverablesPrevious experience in an advisory role (especially in transport / logistics / fleet / auto / sustainability sectors) would be highly regarded.Why us?  We're on a mission to transform transport. We are respected in our field and we work on diverse and interesting projects (if you love vehicles and energy). Many of our projects are nationally significant in shaping our sector and our work creates real, positive outcomes. Clients include all levels of government, industry associations, importers, vehicle manufacturers, NGOs, fuel and energy companies, and green fleet leaders. We help them make good decisions based on sound evidence and our unique, independent insights.We're flexible with the details: finding the right person is more important than job title, hours, and other stuff you might be used to.Interested?  Please only apply if you can demonstrate you meet the requirements above, and if you can share examples of relevant work. Attach a CV and cover letter explaining why you are the person for this role.Please respond via SEEK. Any questions can be directed initially to info@mov3ment.com.au

About DUALDriven by a vision to be the world’s best underwriting business, DUAL has always taken a different approach to our industry peers.Since our business was founded in 2004, we have had a strong entrepreneurial spirit that runs through every part of our business. We empower our people to develop products, services and processes that deliver consistently for our partners. As a company we’re known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events. Whatever you are looking for in a career, we want to help you do more.Our philosophy is simple: we genuinely put people first and want our people to be the healthiest and happiest they can be, at work and at home. We aim to attract and retain the best talent, and support them to achieve their aspirations. It’s how we grow our business and keep one step ahead of our competitors.About the Role We’re looking for an experienced Portfolio Analyst to join our Commercial Team in Sydney. This role will assist in the collection and analysis of data from DUAL systems and databases to create policy, premium and claims reports for analysis and distribution to the wider business on a monthly and ad hoc basis.  This role also ensures a smooth operation by constant process improvement. In this role you will be responsible for;Compiling data to monitor and report on the portfolio performance, synthesizing data into appropriate and concise insightsConduct regular and ad-hoc analysis of the portfolio, including the identification of exposures , variation from target and the preparation of communications to convey findingsExecuting regular templated premium and claims reports to share with Senior Stakeholders in the businessSupporting the maintenance, monitoring and continuous improvement of data analysis files, ongoing review of underpinning assumptions and process documentationProviding analytical support for the development and implementation of portfolio strategies, perform analysis of risk appetite and underwriting rules and adherence to risk appetiteDesign and development of reports on data visualization Platforms such as Power BI.About YouYou will be confident in working independently across multiple systems and tasks and with large volumes of data. As a detail-orientated individual you will have experience in cross referencing files to identify discrepancies and advanced Microsoft Word and Excel skills, allow you to present data and reports in professional formats. You will also:Be a friendly, collaborative team player who is also an independent thinkerHave strong problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to detail, complemented with intellectual curiosityHave great interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and collaborate with different stakeholders across the businessPossess a robust analytical skill set, be deadline-driven, organised and able to multitask Have 2 years of relevant working experience in large volume transaction business, in a role with demonstrably translatable skills.Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications including Power BIAdvanced data skills such as Power Query, SQL would be preferredSalary and BenefitsAt DUAL we value work/life balance, health and wellbeing, family and giving back, which is why our benefits are reflective of this. We provide employees with a competitive salary and benefits, which will be flexible and dependent on the successful candidate’s individual skills and experience. How to ApplyAre you the right fit for this role and the DUAL Team? Tell us why in a short paragraph that you share along with your Resume to our HR Team. Find out moreTo find out more about DUAL Australia including who we are, what we’re up to and what we’re about, head to the DUAL Australia website or visit us on our LinkedIn page. EEO Statement Help us think differently. As a business we’re on a journey to build an inclusive workplace where our people feel welcome to bring their whole and true self to work, where differences are accepted and where our words and actions are inclusive. Together we are learning, sharing stories, and achieving change.

Job Title: Data Analyst - 6 Months Contract - Remote Working
Description: I am currently looking for a data analyst for a large up-coming requirement with one of the largest advertsing & marketing organisations througout the nation. The requirement is urgent and we have set interview slots for Monday. The Candidate:- 3  Years of Power BI experience- Extensive data engineering experience- A good understanding of SQL and related technologies- A good understanding of the full software development lifecycle The Contract:- 6 Months - Open to extension - Remote Working If this sounds like an interesting requirement please apply with your relevant CV. As mentioned interview slots are scheduled for Monday.

Wide Open Agriculture (WOA) is Australia’s leading ASX-listed regenerative food and agriculture company. The Company’s innovative Dirty Clean Food brand markets and distributes food and drink products with a focus on conscious consumers in Australia and South-East Asia. Products are chosen based on their market potential and the positive impact they deliver to farmers, their farmland and regional communities. WOA operates under a ‘4 Returns’ framework and seeks to deliver measurable outcomes on financial, natural, social and inspirational returns.Wide Open Agriculture is committed to fostering an environment that values diversity, equity and inclusion.  We believe our work can make a positive impact on Western Australia and the planet.  We know the best outcomes from our bold mission will come from the ideas, creativity and enthusiasm of a diverse and inclusive workforce.About the roleAs the Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising our database for reporting and forecasting. The ideal candidate is an energetic self-starter who is passionate about both data analytics and the mission of Wide Open Agriculture, who can present complex information in a clear and concise way that helps guide the business to the next level.You will have the opportunity to work in an Agile, close knit, supportive and passionate team for a pioneering company in the regenerative food and agriculture space.  We are a young and fast paced company in an exciting time of growth and looking for a data analyst that can help us make decisions that will drive further growth. We will support your growth and development as a data analyst. And as we are a food company, there is also always plenty of delicious food to try. What you’ll doForecast product sales to inform required inventory to meet demandDesign and implement reports and tracking information to meet stakeholder needs on a defined basisEvaluate product performance and make recommendations on products based on salesConvert and communicate complex data findings (e.g. market and competitor trends and dynamics, cost analysis, profitability analysis) into presentable data visualisations and insights for stakeholders.Provide customer insights as required which include audience profiling, buying habits, profitable customer groups, marketing targets, etcIdentify emerging issues in the current processes and suggest potential solutionsFulfill ad hoc reporting requests, as needed, in support of business initiativesReporting relationships:Direct report to: General ManagerTeam members reporting to this position: nilRequired experience:We are seeking candidates with 2+ years work experience in data analytics. Desirable experience:Held a data analysis role in the food or meat industry.What will make you stand out: Enthusiasm for the green economy + startup landscape!Experience in a fast-paced, high-change business environmentYou believe climate change is real and have a passion for working for a purpose-based organisation
