About the ABSWe are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers. About the roles These are multiple permanent APS5 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.  As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities. You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.  You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator. View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – SSG Recruitment Video - YouTube DutiesYour responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:analysing data for input into statistical compilation and data validation, including using alternative data sourcescommunicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights compiling and publishing statistical products, with a strong focus on continuous improvement applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions  We are seeking people who have: strong conceptual, analytical, and creative skillsprevious work experience in a data or statistical roleexperience working in and contributing to a high performing teamgood oral and written communication skills, and can present and engage with clients/ stakeholdersDesirable (but not essential) are:experience supervising staff, and supporting staff developmentacademic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative componentBenefitsAnnual salary increases Hybrid working (office and work from home)Inclusion and diversity networks Access to mentors and coaches Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)  Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

About Cancer Council NSW
Cancer Council NSW is a community funded and focused not for profit. We are the largest cancer charity in NSW and our point of difference is that we work across every area of every cancer, from research right through to support.
Cancer Council NSW is an inclusive place to volunteer and work. We embrace diversity, celebrate our differences, and inspire each person to be their authentic self at work. As we strive to represent the communities we serve, we welcome and actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and other diverse groups.
About the team
Cancer Council NSW and The University of Sydney have formed a Joint Venture, The Daffodil Centre. Cancer Council NSW is Australia's largest cancer research organisation with established links to policymakers and internationally recognised researchers. The University of Sydney is Australia's first university and its Faculty of Medicine and Health, and Cancer Research Network include many of the world's leading researchers across all health disciplines.
The Daffodil Centre combines the complementary strengths of these two partners to concentrate cancer control research expertise, accelerating the partners' aims towards the realisation of a cancer free future.  It is an exciting time to join the team!
About the role
Based primarily in our Woolloomooloo office, with flexibility to work from home, the role will work towards managing and analysing large datasets for projects within the Cervix & HPV stream research programs, document methods used and prepare tables and figures of results to support the production of reports and publications.
This position will be closely involved in preparing codes, data analyses, report writing, stakeholder engagement and presentation of results, for safety monitoring of National Cervical Screening Programs, for the New Zealand Ministry of Health, and Commonwealth Department of Health.
The Key Responsibilities of the role are:

Be responsible for managing several large health datasets, including all required documentation, ensuring that ethical and privacy requirements are met
Develop, maintain and document computer code to undertake data extraction, cleaning and tabulation of data for research projects and contract work undertaken by the DC
Develop, maintain and use computer code to undertake data analysis for projects in DC research programs
Work effectively with software applications including statistical packages (such as SAS, STATA), word-processing, spreadsheets, databases, and communication tools
Maintain effective working relationships and liaise with team members, collaborators and external agencies including data custodians for downloading data updates as necessary
Assist with preparation of ethics applications, including data analysis protocols, and other reporting relating to data
Preserve the privacy of personal information and confidentiality of study data

Tertiary qualifications in statistics, biostatistics or a related area with a substantial component of numerical analysis or postgraduate training in biostatistics and epidemiology
Experience in using and developing code for statistical software packages, in particular SAS or STATA
Experience in managing, interpreting and analysing complex data; preferably with experience in health-related data and linked datasets
Experience in the analysis of epidemiological data; familiarity with methods of categorical and continuous data analysis using logistic regression, generalized linear models, and related regression techniques
Demonstrated skills in word processing, spreadsheets, databases and graphics software
A demonstrated interest in health-related research, preferably including tertiary qualifications in public health or a similar field
Understanding of research ethics requirements
Excellent writing skills with experience in the preparation of reports or publications

About the Role
An opportunity has arisen for an Analyst to join our Group Technology team in a Permanent position based in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.
The role is responsible for overseeing the identification, reporting and resolution of instances of non-compliance and ensuring the prevention of further occurrences through the continual development of improvements to processes, procedures and controls.
Key Role Responsibilities:
Design, and maintain a fit for purpose quality framework and test scripts to support oversight / file review / monitoring activities
Deliver on the outcomes of the Quality Program / Framework to support better experience for our customers and ensure compliance to policies and procedures
Support Quality Monitoring Officers by coordinating resolution and remediation of all identified errors and compliance breaches including the preparation of action plans
Support for operational teams in delivering corrective action (eg. coaching and customer remediation)
Ensure escalation and effective reporting of insights and root cause analysis across the function is provided to relevant leadership stakeholders so that appropriate action is taken to minimise re-occurrence
Identify, recommend and implement improvements to processes, procedures and controls across the function
Assist in writing and support the delivery of effective technical training and coaching solutions in response to findings, remediation activities and improvement initiatives
In conjunction with Management and First Line Risk, support the review and remediation of Operational Risk Events (OREs)
Key liaison for audit preparation and remediation of audit outcomes where required
Key point of contact and co-ordination of project resource (SME) requirements
Maintain effective relationships with internal business units, key contacts and relevant third parties e.g. customers, suppliers, regulators
About you
To be successful in this role you will possess the ability to engage and influence key stakeholders across all levels of  business with the aim of driving improvement and quality adherence initiatives. Advanced report writing, negotiation, presentation and verbal communication skills are a must as you help support the required behavioral and cultural change. 
Ideally you will have the below skills, knowledge and experience:
Considerable operational experience with the Banks systems and applications;
Knowledge of continuous improvement principles such as Lean Six Sigma;
Experience in using MS Office, particularly Excel and Pro-map;
Experience in preparing, analysing and presenting data and process documentation
Relevant Tertiary Qualification.

BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.
BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.
BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Summary:At Elysium Digital, you can expect to work with the best and the brightest and have a lot of fun along the way with our collaborative, flexible, and fun culture! We like to do things a little differently here at Elysium Digital. We have built an incredible culture through attracting some of the best people in the industry and we have a lot of fun doing what we love. Our teams work on industry leading projects, use the latest technology, receive amazing benefits and we offer an organisational structure that truly supports your career!!! Sound like an awesome place to work??? Cool, let’s chat!About your new companyElysium Digital aren’t like other Digital Consultancies, I know, you have heard it all before, but stick with us. We believe in creating a better Australia by supporting our clients to build best practice digital solutions and achieve their ambitions and vision for the future. We understand that our people are the most important part of our business, and more than that, we care about our employees, so we built our company with people at the centre.Your new roleEnough about us, we’re more interested in you anyway! If you’re a Business/ Digital Analyst who believes they have what it takes to work with the best and brightest in the industry and can demonstrate high levels of competency in the below then we’re keen to chat:Work with product owners to understand their vision, and translate it into epics, users stories and tasksWork as part of a multidisciplinary agile team, supporting developers, UXers, testers to deliver the right outcome for our clientsLead and/ or collaborate during sprints events, always aiming at delivering better and being part of the high performing team Ensure that artefacts are being updated continuously to reflect the latest release Generating innovative digital solutions by approaching problems with curiosity and open mindedness, use existing information to its fullest potentialDriving operational excellence and innovationWhat can we offer you?We want work to be fun! That’s why we go up and beyond to ensure that we offer the best workplace which includes:Salary: Attractive remuneration packages that demonstrates the value we put on your skills and capability.Career Progression: Each of our employees are unique, which is why you will receive a Partner Career Manager from day one to support your individual career aspirations. They will work with you every step of the way to ensure you have everything you want and need to take your career in right the direction.Culture: Our culture is the lifeblood of our business - we have a fun, supportive, and diverse environment including flexibility and work-life balance.For you: The opportunity to make a big impact in our rapidly growing business where you’ll be surrounded by likeminded, talented experts.Employee benefits: We are industry leaders when it comes to our employee experience. We offer benefits which include a best practice parental leave policy, training and development benefits, tech, subscriptions and allowances plus more.Why should you work here?We know you have a lot of companies to choose from, and we can go on and on by telling you why we think you should work at Elysium Digital, but we think you should hear it from our employees firsthand: ‘I love being surrounded by highly talented people in a supportive and fun environment where I get to make a difference every day’.Your next stepsWe know when it sounds too good to be true it usually is, but in this case, it is this good. If you want to take control of your career and hear more about our opportunities and vision, click apply now OR contact us at HR@elysiumdigital.com.au

You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.  You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator. View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – SSG Recruitment Video - Job Title: Data Analyst - Contract - Daily Rate - $900/Day Inc Super
Description: Data Analyst required for an immediate start to join a pre existing team of Analysts for a well known financial services organisation to assist with the integration of a recent acquisition.  Skillset & Experience:  Know how write SQL, how to transform data or read any transformation, ability to derive and handle exception. Our Client:Our client has a large presence within the retail/trade industry, they are currently seeking a Helpdesk Support Analyst to join on an initial 12-month contract.The primary focus for this role is to monitor daily data feeds of both internally and externally sourced data to the Client's Data Warehouse. This includes liaising with internal staff and 3rd parties to investigate and drive the resolution of issues. Additionally, you'll support the ongoing expansion of external feeds (from new stores & other service providers) in line with business needs.About the roleYou would be involved in:Monitor daily data feeds sourced from stores & other 3rdFollow up with stores, external agencies and/or internal IT staff to diagnose problems, ensure any issues are resolved and the required data is loaded into our data warehouse.Provide timely & accurate reporting of the status of our various data feeds.Work with stores & POS solution providers to bring onboard new stores' scan data feedsYou will engage directly with the Business Intelligence Team and overtime be exposed to BI Analytics tools, such as MicroStrategy.Monitor & administer user access rights & privileges to our clients Data Warehousing & Analytics tools To be successful for the role, you would ideally have:Minimum 2 years experience in a hands-on Service Desk, Production Support or software development roleExperience in accessing files & databases in both Windows & Unix environmentsAbility to interrogate data in flat files & relational databases such as Oracle & MS-SQL using tools such as TOAD and demonstrate strong MS-Excel skillsWell-developed problem-solving skills and ability to work with 3rd party IT service providersExperience in a retail or wholesale business environment is desirable but not mandatory If you are seeking the next step in your career, please APPLY NOW.For any further questions or information, please contact Haniksha on (03) 8080 7225 and quote job #242770

Who are we? |Conveniently located within the Essendon Fields precinct, LaManna is a true leader within the retail industry. As a trusted brand in the food retail market and with a focus on providing exceptional products and service to our loyal customers, we are always looking for our next Superstar to join our team, our family.Why do we exist? |LaManna is strongly driven to simply make people happy, to create lasting experiences through the joy of food and to challenge the known and unknown. Our team come to work each day with a goal to create a positive impact with those who visit our store. It begins with a welcoming smile into our home, offering a delightful journey throughout, having access to exceptional quality products and arousing the senses. Our customer will leave inspired to create something special, with the desire to return for more and so the journey never ends. Our success is merely creating a happy place for our customers and our family.The Role |We are looking for that person who is deeply motivated and easily inspired, to join our growing family. You will come into our home and immediately feel welcomed and motivated to embrace the ‘why’ we exist. We want someone who wants to wake up every morning and love coming to work because we believe that’s what everyone should experience in the morning. We have had tremendous growth and success as a business, and the technologies that served us well in our growth, no longer serve the future of our business. We are now looking to transform our business through technology. This presents an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our team and have their career grow, as we transform our business. Reporting directly to the Information Technology Operations Manager, the Business Analyst is responsible for researching progressive systems solutions to evaluating their impact and providing the business with a tailored outcome to improve current and forward practices. The Business Analyst is a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst. They are committed to the discovery and development of innovative solutions in an ever-changing digital landscape.The role would include reasonable overtime. Key Tasks and Responsibilities |Collecting, validating and documenting business requirements​Analysing viable data such as budgets, sales results and forecastsDemonstrating business practices and identifying opportunities for improvements​Recognising issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions and outlining business impactsCreating efficient specifications for solutions​Assessing costs and identifying business savings​Simplifying information and translating technical jargon so it is easily understood by the whole team​Implementing and testing of solutions​Supporting business transition and helping to create changeDefining business requirements and reporting back to stakeholdersSkills and Experience |Minimum 5+ years industry experience in a similar roleMust be able to easily conceptualize complex processes and break them down to workable increments.Experience working closely with software development teams.Ability to manage multiple workloads by prioritiesBachelor's degree in business information systems minimum, Masters preferred.Relational databases experience, MSSQL, MYSQL, AirtableAbility to define business process operations and sync processes against modern APIsProven experience implementing new software from conception to completion, from requirements gathering to end user training, whilst ensuring deadlines are kept.Experience with Stacker HQ and Airtable is highly regardedCheck Us Out |http://www.lamannas.com.au/ https://www.instagram.com/lamannasupermarket/ https://www.facebook.com/lamannasupermarket/ If this sounds like a place you could see yourself being a part of, then apply now. We are excited to receive your application.We require you to submit a cover letter as part of your application. We want to know who you are and why you want to join our family. We strongly believe that your individuality and personality is just as important as your experience and skills.We pride ourselves on an inclusive and supportive team who work with each other to achieve great outcomes in everything we do.

At Bunnings, you'll make an impact on the business and beyond. At Bunnings, there's so much going on behind the scenes that may come as a surprise. With millions of customer interactions occurring across our stores and online platforms, we've got so many opportunities to shape our trademark Bunnings experiences for our customers. About the roleThe purpose of this role is to capture the essence of our business in data models that underpin a usable, scalable and sustainable data solution. As the Data Modeller you are enabling and supporting the Data Function at an Enterprise level from Business Intelligence, Reporting and the Data Science machine learning pipelines.What's involved:Analysing and translating business metrics and measures to develop technical design artefacts and standards-based data models that support long-term solutions.Working with the Data Engineering team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models.Creating & maintaining logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy.Developing best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.Being a key contributor to solutions that are pragmatic, maintainable and enable real business improvement. Who we're looking for:You are an analytical, outcome driven problem solver who is flexible and adaptable in their approach to work and possesses excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.You'll need:Proven experience as a Data Modeller in Retail or a similar industryExperience working in Agile, cross-functional teams at Enterprise scaleExperience using data modelling tools such as ERWIN, SqlDBM, DBSchemaKnowledge of Snowflake data warehouse or similar cloud data warehouse service highly desirableIntimate knowledge of data warehousing with respect to various data methodologies, such as Data Vault 3NF and KimballYou'll be part of a workplace where you'll feel like you belong.There's so much on offer when you're part of the team. Our flexible and informal work environmenthelps bring balance between work and home. Then there's the fun stuff like team discount at Bunnings and other Wesfarmers brands, incentives, discounts from corporate partners (such as private health insurance) and cost price food and drinks at the Bunnings café. We also offer 12 weeks paid parental leave, regardless of gender, and you will have the opportunity to create a real difference in your community and environment. Join us and experience Bunnings from the other side of the counter. Please note that if your application progresses to the reference check stage, you may be required to submit a police check. If your search returns a criminal record, Bunnings will assess whether the record impacts your ability to perform the key requirements of the role.

Company Overview:My client is a national home builder with a strong foothold in the Melbourne marketplace. Established team with a strong client list that has been built over the past 30 years. Due to ongoing growth, the business requires a strong Service Desk Analyst to join the team. About the RoleThis position’s focus is to provide a development lifecycle to Data Analytics and AI/BI reporting utilising PowerBI within the Business environment and acting as a Project Manager for key or special projects.   This is includes Developing, verifying, deploying and maintaining analytical and reporting tools. The PowerBI and Special Projects Manager needs to provide support to all stakeholders while supporting integrations and database systems to ensure accurate data and business reporting.   The PowerBI and Specialist should also be a strong Project Manager who can use project methodologies such as Agile, to write and build supporting business cases, project plans and project schedules which will support the development and improvement of the business environment and Analytics and BI reporting capabilities.  Position Responsibilities  Liaise with both business and IT stakeholders to create reporting interfaces, tools, and solutions. The Data Analyst and BI Developer will be responsible for the full lifecycle from design and development to implementation, demonstrate and provide hands on support. Undertake, lead and participate in projects and BI improvements to implement continJGuous improvement of core reporting and data Analytics, supporting (Including the writing and the providing of business cases, budgets, projects plan and project schedules). Create, Design and Develop data warehouse facts and dimensions. Create or refine and optimise ETL processes for new and existing data sources. Provide technical support on day-to-day issues or queries on deployments and releases. Including liaising with the ICT ServiceDesk. Liaise, support, train others business users and assist with data model builds, including training for application handovers. Create visualisation dashboards and reports (Power BI, Tableau, and other BI tools). Working with the team to troubleshoot identified issues and ensure they have been diagnosed, estimated, and resolved correctly. Continuously locate, investigate, and correct issues in data quality. Provide information on the impact to reports, during proposed system changes or functional changes Ensure Tools used for reporting and delivery are correctly licensed and have maintenance coverage. Provide ongoing status reports, roadblocks, recommendations, budgetary reviews, cost controls and introduce BI and reporting improvements.  Your Qualifications and experience:  Completion of a MCSE or MCSA certification, combined with ICT Tertiary qualification or equivalent working experience. 5+ year’s experience in a similar role 5+ year’s Data Analyst experience within a large organisation 3+ year’s experience with Power BI (desktop and server) within a large organisation, including architecture, gateways, design, implementation, dashboard development, visualisation, and data modelling. Experience with report collaboration, security and sharing in Power BI and other similar BI tools. 5+ year’s ETL and integration development experience through a wide variety of sources 5+ year’s experience with database and data warehouse implementation and design. Extensive experience across the full Microsoft BISQL stack 5+ year’s experience delivering business cases and Project, utilizing project management methodologies. Strong experience with DAX, JavaScript, CSS and HTML Experience in using the Microsoft Power Platform (e.g. Power Apps, Flow) Solid experience with Microsoft Excel, Dynamics SL, SharePoint and VBA

About Us   At CleanCo, we are shaping the future of energy in Queensland as the state’s low-emissions electricity generation and trading company. We operate and trade a portfolio including wind, solar, hydro, and gas-fired power stations and develop innovative energy solutions for our customers while promoting competition in the energy market. We are harnessing Queensland’s natural gifts to fuel leading industrial and commercial customers with clean, affordable, reliable energy while unlocking the next horizon of sustainable growth for Queensland’s regions and hubs.  To realise that vision, we strive to create an organisation that is representative of Queensland and its people. We are a team of people who are motivated to create a better world now and for future generations, and if that resonates with you, we invite you to consider a career with CleanCo. We value and respect people of all ages, genders, races, religions, sexual orientation, abilities and cultural backgrounds.  About the Role The Strategy Analyst exists to support strategic decision making. This is achieved through collation of business intelligence, analysis of market data, long-term scenario planning, and business case evaluation for specific investment decisions. About You You are a consultative and collaborative analyst able to build strong working relationships across a variety of stakeholders. You have demonstrated success in analysis and problem solving, including a rigorous understanding of risk and variability, and offer an ability to convert this into to supporting advice for commercial decision making.  You are Degree qualified in a field which emphasises quantifying and solving problems such as economics, engineering, data or natural sciences, and are eager to apply these studies to a purpose led role.  You can effectively communicate ideas in written reports or presentations. You can undertake advanced analysis and financial modelling in Excel. Experience with relevant industry tools or ability to use more advanced analytical tools such as R or SQL would be an advantage. You have a passion to be part of something bigger than yourself, that contributes to the delivery of low emission, renewable, reliable, and affordable energy for Queensland.    What We Can OfferWe understand that work is just one important aspect of our employee’s lives, therefore we offer benefits that support balance such as flexible working options, paid parental leave, parent's room, and discounted health insurance. How to ApplyTo apply please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking ‘apply’.  For more information about CleanCo please visit www.cleancoqueensland.com.au

LifeHealthcare is an independent supplier of high-end medical devices in Australia and New Zealand and one of the leaders in its field. We’re Australian owned, so not your typical multinational. If working in a dynamic company with leading technologies and where improving patient outcomes, drive you to succeed and you like to think you’re not your typical candidate then our Master Data Specialist role may be just what you’re looking for! If you are deadline focused with strong attention to detail and accuracy and are motivated by driving a culture of continuous improvement, then read on! Reporting to the Master Data Lead you will be working within a small and supportive team and have touch points across the whole business. This is an appealing opportunity for someone interested in building a strong career in in Medical Devices and prides themselves on their excellent problem-solving skills. You’ll stand out from the crowd if you:  Have strong SAP Inventory Control or Supply Chain experience & knowledge of how Master Data helps to drive process. Master Data skills a definite advantage Are service oriented and possess strong interpersonal skills with excellent customer skills Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Demonstrate a can-do attitude and hands on work style    You’ll be responsible for:  Coordinate with stakeholders to understand requirements and execute changes to SAP master data as approved by the business in line with defined SOPs Test and perform regular business-related activities such as pricing updates, Prothesis list updates, inactive data objects, general data cleanse and review Build relationships and support business users through timely resolution of master data queries and issues Initiate regular data audits to identify any discrepancies and inconsistencies & work with business users to ensure progressive development and accuracy of data. Assist business process analysts in defining standard operating procedures, process flows and related documentation    And to be successful we think you’ll need: At least 3 years’ experience in an inventory control or supply chain SAP environment. An Ability to converse with both end-users and BIS/IT employees at all levels of the organisation will be highly regarded.    Culture and Benefits: At LifeHealthcare Our passion is health and Our purpose is helping to make life better for others. As an organisation, everything we do is guided by a set of values that define our character and culture; Accountable, Agile, Authentic and Customer Centric and we are driven to succeed in delivering the best outcomes for our patients. This is a real opportunity for you to make a difference in the lives of others and to influence change in our growing organisation.    We offer flexible work arrangements promoting an environment to deliver your best, recognising that you can do that either in the office or working from home. People are at the centre of everything we do and to this end, we offer well-being benefits & financial rewards to promote excellence in our employees, salary sacrifice options, study assistance and a have generous parental leave policy. We also offer free onsite parking.    If this all sounds like something you want to be a part of, APPLY now and work with a company that is not your typical multinational and watch your career grow.    **No Agencies thank you; we have this role covered**

Company description:Queensland Rail's purpose is to provide a customer-focused, safe, reliable, on-time, value for money rail service that benefits the community, supports industry and is integrated with the public transport system. The organisation's vision is connecting communities through a modern, world-class rail service.Job description:Queensland Rail is currently seeking Business Analysts to join our SEQ Assets team in 2 newly created permanent positions. This is an opportunity to use your experience in SAP R3, reporting software (i.e., SAP BI, Tableau) to support reporting, data analysis, current and future state process mapping, as well as drive the development of analytical capability across projects and business as usual activities within the Strategy and Planning team. About the role:  Generate reports from corporate systems, anaylse data, identify trends and anomalies, and define recommendations to support business decision making. Job Title: RESEARCH ASSOCIATE - Data Visualisation Specialist - Agronomic and Economic Data
Description: Job reference: 845978SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING – SCHOOL OF MOLECULAR AND LIFE SCIENCES    The Centre for Crop and Disease Management at Curtin University brings together university expertise in data science, geographical information systems, farming systems, agribusiness, and actuarial science. We have strong industry partners and focus on research to overcome key challenges in the horticulture and broadacre agricultural industries.     The Centre for Crop and Disease Management (CCDM) at Curtin are partnering with CSIRO Agriculture and Food and CSIRO Data61, jointly developing important digital technologies to address new problems in the agricultural sector. Data61 is the data and digital specialist arm of CSIRO and home to one of the largest collections of research and development expertise in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and data science in the world, hosting cutting-edge facilities including the Mixed Reality Lab, Robotics Innovation Centre and AI4Cyber Enclave. You will you have the chance to work with staff from CSIRO and Curtin University to address industry related problems with big data.    In this role you will    In this research focused position, you will further develop the research and leadership skills critically important for your future career roles and you will use your data capture, data visualisation and data analytical skills to address industry related problems. Data sources may come from proximal sensors, data loggers, remote sensing imagery, industry records or ground surveys. You will combine and integrate these complex sources of data to develop data science driven solutions that help agricultural producers solve real world problems. This includes identifying the data streams available for the agricultural sector: data streams may include information from proximal sensors, satellite imagery, industry data and ground surveys.    Working within a team, you will engage with industry to co-design solutions to problems they face and develop questions for further research. You will create visual, data driven outputs to assist farm businesses to make critical decisions using agricultural data in an effective and timely manner. We are looking for someone with  Essential  A PhD in Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Biological modelling or an equivalent field. Demonstrated experience with modern analytic platforms such as Python or R Excellent oral and written skills including the ability to communicate statistical results to non- statisticians and industry representatives Experience in data processing and data management Demonstrated experience with multiple packages in R or python Evidence of familiarity or experience with High Performance Computer facilities A commitment to research as evidenced by peer reviewed publications  Desirable   Understanding of experimental design as applied to biology or agricultural research. Training or supervisory experience with undergraduate and/or postgraduate students and/or industry personnel. Commitment to HSE and Diversity and Inclusive workplace principles  Why choose to join Curtin   Opportunity for ongoing career development. State of the art facilities to support your research, Exchange is dedicated to being an industry-connected innovation precinct. Perth based position, Business hours. A flexible benefits package with excellent superannuation provisions. We are ranked in the top 1% of universities worldwide (ARWU 2020 and QS World University Rankings 2021).  For further information on Curtin’s employee benefits visit https://about.curtin.edu.au/jobs/  COVID 19 – Vaccination Policy Candidates should note that some Curtin University positions are covered by the Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for WA workforces. www.wa.gov.au/government/announcements/mandatory-covid-19-vaccination-policy-wa-workforces If the position you are applying for is covered by this policy, you will be required to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination status (or formally granted exemption) prior to commencing employment. Next steps To apply, please complete the online application form via the link below, noting we cannot accept resumes sent to the below email address. Please include a cover letter, resume and separate document addressing the selection criteria (outlined above) to enable us to assess your suitability for the role. Description:
Join one of Australia’s Most Trusted Brands
Bendigo and Adelaide Bank is on a journey towards becoming Australia's bank of choice.  Our Purpose is the same today as it was when we were founded 160 years ago, and every day, we work hard to bring our company purpose to life; feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it.
 
About the Department
The Financial Crime Risk team is at the leading edge of AML and Financial Crime prevention and detection for the Bendigo and Adelaide Group under the Financial Crime Risk management framework.
 
About the Role
As the demand grows for our expertise, we have an additional role in the team.  It’s about support to maintain and help grow the intelligence and analytical capability for the management of financial crime risk across the department and the broader group; support the identification, maintenance and disruption of financial crime.
This is a 12-month fixed term position; various locations of Melbourne, Adelaide & Bendigo will be considered and the successful candidate:

has a national responsibility and availability to travel and work away from the office and home is essential
work in different locations from time to time and sometimes at unusual hours

 
Experience, capabilities and qualifications

Solid experience in Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Analytics
Identifying and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
Strong ability to summarise and articulate results to stakeholders
Intermediate to Advanced skills in SQL, Microsoft Excel, VBA
Working knowledge of big data analysis tools like R, Python etc
Working knowledge of visualisation tools like PowerBI, Qlik etc
Exposure to financial crime risk management, with emphasis on AML/CTF, Sanctions and Fraud is advantageous.

Attributes

Ability to find practical and viable solutions to complex problems
Investigative, intuitive mindset and curiosity

 
What we Offer
Here you’ll have variety and choice in your career direction; with opportunity to move up or across the organisation, through a diverse mix of business areas and roles.
At Bendigo and Adelaide Bank we believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.
If you’re excited to be part of an organisation with strong values and a community focus - then this could be the role for you! Apply now.  Applications close 8 February.
 
It is a condition of employment with the Bank that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless you have a medical contraindication or acute illness which prevents you from receiving the vaccine and you provide satisfactory evidence of this to the Bank.

Job Title: Junior Data Scientist - Property and Retail
Description: We are currently recruiting a Junior Data Scientist for an internal team based in Sydney CBD – please note, the preference will go to candidates with relevant professional data science experience. In this role, you will work with some outstanding senior data scientists and managers in end-to-end work that will range from business analytics through to machine learning and predictive modelling. This is a mature and high-performance team that delivers pragmatic and valuable solutions to a range of business units and stakeholders. As such, you will need to bring strong statistical & mathematical foundations, commercial acumen and ideally around 2 years of commercial analytics or data science experience.     What kind of work will you do in this role and team?  Work closely with a very high calibre data science team, with strong leaders to mentor you in technical and business aspects Use cutting-edge analytics and data tools: Apache Spark, Google Cloud Platform, Python, Scala, Hive, SQL, R, Tableau & more Solving new problems with data - so you may work on improving existing models, greenfield POCs that then move into production and more Varied use cases and wide variety of large datasets Range of short projects, answering interesting questions with data and longer-term data science/ML projects        Required Skills & Experience:  You must have a minimum of 1-2 years working in a commercial/professional analytics or data science role An academic background in statistics, mathematics, computer science, actuarial studies or similar is desirable Experience building end-to-end models, through requirement gathering, data cleansing and management, feature engineering, modelling, testing/optimising, presentation of insights (including data visualisation or automation of reporting), etc. SQL skills are a must for ETL, data management and either Python or R are expected for building models Any Apache Spark or GCP experience is beneficial (big query, pub/sub, dataflow, etc.) Sydney location only (hybrid work planned when Covid-safe, e.g. 2-3 days in the office and 2-3 days per week work-from-home)       Benefits of this role:  This is a fantastic career opportunity to join one of the top data science teams in Sydney! The business is extremely successful and has a large data footprint and wide variety of use-cases to apply analytics and machine learning to. There is a high-performing team, with great mentors and leaders and an expectation for continued learning. Flexible work is encouraged and they have fostered a friendly, open and agile team culture that values diversity.    At this stage, we are only able to consider applicants with full Australian working rights.

The Department of Jobs, Precincts and Regions (DJPR) was established to ensure Victoria's strong economic performance by growing industries and regions. Here at DJPR, we're making sure Victoria's economy benefits all Victorians by creating more jobs for more people, building thriving places and regions and nurturing inclusive communities.
The position of Data Analyst - DWH forms a part of the program centre within the Corporate Services and Delivery group.
The Program Centre supports the oversight and administration of grants and grant programs across DJPR. The Program Centre's aim is to drive continuous improvement in order to efficiently and effectively administer grant programs to deliver outcomes for the Victorian Government and the community.
The Program Centre provides advice on best practice grant program design, as well as implementation and grant administration services through a cost recovery model.
The Data Analyst works within the Program Centre which is responsible for leading centralised program design and systems integration for Department programs and initiatives that drive outcomes for key business, industry and community sectors across the Victorian economy.
The key accountabilities of the role are:

Provide technical data analysis and modelling through the collection of information from GEMS/Oracle Datawarehouse and other relevant data sources and translate into reports appropriate for grant program management and analysis for stakeholders across the department.
Coordinate the analysis of grants data and identify and action solutions and initiatives to support data cleansing and data integrity.
Develop, schedule and update reports.
Liaise with staff across the department regarding grants data, compliance and administration.
Actively contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and systems.

About the Role
An opportunity has arisen for an Analyst to join our Group Technology team in a Permanent position based in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.
The role is responsible for overseeing the identification, reporting and resolution of instances of non-compliance and ensuring the prevention of further occurrences through the continual development of improvements to processes, procedures and controls.
Key Role Responsibilities:
Design, and maintain a fit for purpose quality framework and test scripts to support oversight / file review / monitoring activities
Deliver on the outcomes of the Quality Program / Framework to support better experience for our customers and ensure compliance to policies and procedures
Support Quality Monitoring Officers by coordinating resolution and remediation of all identified errors and compliance breaches including the preparation of action plans
Support for operational teams in delivering corrective action (eg. coaching and customer remediation)
Ensure escalation and effective reporting of insights and root cause analysis across the function is provided to relevant leadership stakeholders so that appropriate action is taken to minimise re-occurrence
Identify, recommend and implement improvements to processes, procedures and controls across the function
Assist in writing and support the delivery of effective technical training and coaching solutions in response to findings, remediation activities and improvement initiatives
In conjunction with Management and First Line Risk, support the review and remediation of Operational Risk Events (OREs)
Key liaison for audit preparation and remediation of audit outcomes where required
Key point of contact and co-ordination of project resource (SME) requirements
Maintain effective relationships with internal business units, key contacts and relevant third parties e.g. customers, suppliers, regulators
About you
To be successful in this role you will possess the ability to engage and influence key stakeholders across all levels of  business with the aim of driving improvement and quality adherence initiatives. Advanced report writing, negotiation, presentation and verbal communication skills are a must as you help support the required behavioral and cultural change. 
Ideally you will have the below skills, knowledge and experience:
Considerable operational experience with the Banks systems and applications;
Knowledge of continuous improvement principles such as Lean Six Sigma;
Experience in using MS Office, particularly Excel and Pro-map;
Experience in preparing, analysing and presenting data and process documentation
Relevant Tertiary Qualification.

BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.
BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.
BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.
In 2021 BOQ Group was awarded a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation.

This senior analyst role supports the Business Data Manager (Business Engagement) functions for a subset of the Group’s data assets to ensure compliance with the Group’s information management policies.

About the Role
As a Customer Experience Analyst at Virgin Money, you’ll be joining a team who are passionate about improving the experience our customers have with us. Working in a smaller group, you will collaborate cross functionally with a range of other departments, including marketing, product and digital - everything that our customers touch we get involved with.
By analysing data and customer insights collected from surveys this will help you to look at where the pain points are to establish what works well, and what improvements can be made. This is not a role if you’re into crunching numbers, this is a role for someone who is able to put themselves in the customers shoes to make the customer experience smoother and more enjoyable.
About you
A true Customer Experience Analyst, you love working with customer data and are able to draw on insights through a Voice of Customer program. Using these, you’ll help to create better outcomes by continually improving the customer journey with your solid problem solving, strong written and verbal communication skills and high attention to detail. About the Opportunity  A newly created role has become available for talented Senior Digital Insights Analysts to join our Health Insurance - Domestic Retail Portfolio business unit on a permanent full-time basis. This role will ideally be based in our Melbourne office when you are not working from home (we offer flexible working)  The purpose of the Senior Digital Insights Analyst role is to produce ongoing end-to-end customer journey analysis by integrating data from the online and offline platforms. With deep understanding of online/offline data and business context, the role will work closely with the Digital team in providing actionable insights across the BUPA digital estate.  How will I help?  Key accountabilities include: Integration of digital and enterprise data to perform end-to-end customer journey analysisProactively assess website traffic and analyse online customer behaviour to provide insights and recommend actions for improvement in the user experience and website conversion.Contribute to support optimisation & personalisation activities through ideation, actionable insights from data, hypotheses generation.Create accessible self-service dashboards and actionable insights that are fact based, intuitive and re-usable.Support the Digital Insights lead in developing an efficient digital analytics 'factory' with appropriate balance of automation and deeper bespoke reporting.Collaborate with other reporting and insights teams across Bupa to develop insights and share knowledge to support overall business performance.Create compelling data visualizations for impactful presentation of insights, including metric creation/designActively contribute in the standardization of the digital data layer through solid understanding of key building blocks of data strategy, for example an understanding of the role of the data layer (re-use, standardisation) and how data is collected and storedWhat's in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements, you'll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will collaborate strongly with colleagues who are committed to delivering exceptional experiences. We trust, respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk highlights: Discount on our health insurance, travel, car, home, contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store.A 'People First' wellness program - SMILE. Provides a range of services such as health coaches, annual skin checks and flu vaccinations, assistance with nutrition, mental and general well-being guides and product discounts. You will feel happier & healthier for working at Bupa!What do I need?  This role would suit an experienced Digital Analyst with at least 3-5yrs of experience who is looking to take a step up with responsibilities and who has demonstrated skills with Adobe Analytics.  You will be/have: Tertiary qualification in business/statistics/analytical or related disciplineDeep experience in a similar role with exposure to Digital Analytics tools and frameworksDemonstrated ability in integration of digital and enterprise data to perform end-to-end customer journey analysisDemonstrated experience in using web analytics tools and testing tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics, Adobe TargetExperience in customer data platforms such as Tealium Audience Stream to contribute in the website personalisation activities is desirableExperience in SQL, SAS, R or Python as a scripting language is advantageous.· As a natural communicator, you can use the data to tell a story and have the confidence to challenge your peers.  What is it like to work there?  Bupa is a world leading Health & Care organisation with over 22,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. In Australia, we help to take care of people through our leading health insurance services as well as providing a personalised approach to care through our modern Dental clinic network, our Bupa Optical stores, Bupa Medical Visa services and over 70 Bupa Aged Care Homes. Bupa Therapy, along with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa, your wellbeing, identity and own story is respected and valued.

About the Role
As a Customer Experience Analyst at Virgin Money, you’ll be joining a team who are passionate about improving the experience our customers have with us. Working in a smaller group, you will collaborate cross functionally with a range of other departments, including marketing, product and digital - everything that our customers touch we get involved with.
By analysing data and customer insights collected from surveys this will help you to look at where the pain points are to establish what works well, and what improvements can be made. This is not a role if you’re into crunching numbers, this is a role for someone who is able to put themselves in the customers shoes to make the customer experience smoother and more enjoyable.
About you
A true Customer Experience Analyst, you love working with customer data and are able to draw on insights through a Voice of Customer program. Using these, you’ll help to create better outcomes by continually improving the customer journey with your solid problem solving, strong written and verbal communication skills and high attention to detail. Not one to sit around and wait for direction, you enjoy building your own personal brand within the business by engaging with various stakeholders and teams you’ll be interacting with.
It does not matter if you have banking experience for this role or not, what we are looking for is someone who has previously worked as a Customer Experience Analyst (or similar), has a genuine care and desire about improving customer experiences at Virgin Money while learning from the best. If you love working with customer data and being part of a close-knit team, are dedicated and a hard-working team player, then this could be the role for you.
For this role we are open to people who are based in either Sydney or Brisbane.
About Us
Part of the global family of great Virgin brands (and owned by the Bank of Queensland Group), Virgin Money is a financial services business that is passionate about helping Australians realise bigger possibilities through the delivery of beautifully simple and rewarding financial products, backed by Virgin’s legendary customer service. We reject the notion of complex financial services. Instead we aim for clarity and simplicity in everything we do.
Our Benefits
Flexible working arrangements
Discounted financial products
Salary sacrificing options
Paid parental leave with no minimum
Paid volunteer days
Purchase annual leave
BUPA Corporate Plan
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
A ‘zero tolerance’ to Domestic and Family Violence (DFV) with active support for employees experiencing DFV
Accessible work support through various practices, systems, office adjustments
	Gym, shopping, technology and travel offers
5 employee diversity network groups focusing on; First Nations Reconciliation Council, EPIC (LTBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career.

These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks

The Group Marketing Customer Communications Insights (CCI) team is responsible for building and enabling analytics solution for the marketing analytics teams to support the strategic design, development of effective customer communications across their preferred channels.

With tertiary qualifications in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other analytical fields of study, coupled with a strong customer focus at your core, you can demonstrate:

Leading the build and deployment of machine learning models to achieve business outcomes

Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP

Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills 
Strong communications skills, able to convey complex messages in a simple and effective manner

Who are we? Come join our collaborative, flexible and friendly team at Standards Australia and be a part of Australia’s future! We are the peak non-government Standards body in Australia and we facilitate the creation of standards which help govern the specifications that products and services in Australia should live up to. We work closely with government, industry, consumer, and stakeholder groups and are working in exciting areas such as circular economy, artificial intelligence, renewal energy and smart tech.   We are experiencing an exciting period of growth embarking on a number of new projects, which would see our current team of 250+ employees grow substantially throughout 2022, our centenary year. About the role Standards Australia’s publications are distributed through distribution arrangements with third parties. Standards Australia are moving towards a multiple distribution channel model and is working steadily to put in place business policies, practices and processes to be able to support this objective, including building systems to support a direct-channel market strategy. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing pricing frameworks which support the business in its transition to a multi distribution channel model.What you'll do The Pricing Analyst will work across a number of areas of our operations on a cross functional basis. In particular, the position will lead:   Development of a framework for the management of prices for access to content for customers, including third party distributors Development of frameworks and processes to manage subscription and other products Development of pricing models for new and existing products and customer solutions Review, and where necessary, drive escalation of pricing tickets to enable approval of pricing for Publications Analyse trends in the market and customers, and demonstrate their impact Preparing reports to support key decisions presented at an executive pricing committee Assist in preparation of monthly, quarterly and annual forecast Design, create and prepare a suite of reports to support the different business requirements providing analytics, insights and recommendations to optimise business decisions Working collaboratively with partners to achieve business outcomes Strict adherence to our Data Sharing protocol    Many of these responsibilities require engagement across different teams and business units. Essential to your success will be your ability to work and collaborate across teams and business functions.About you  A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role University degree, or other relevant qualification, in a field such as business, commerce, accounting or data analysis Tertiary qualification in Commerce or Finance or business-related field Prior experience in an operations/pricing based analyst role Ability to communicate and work effectively with team members at all levels Strong administration experience  Working for usIntegrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect and Excellence form the basis of all we do. Our success is measured not only on the outcomes but on the path we took to get there.  Standards Australia offer a flexible and positive culture where individual and team efforts are recognised and rewarded. We celebrate our success through quarterly events such as EOY party, Family Day, Melbourne Cup, Awards and Picnic day. We also promote training through our internal L&D team and access to services like LinkedIn learning and toastmasters. What's next?If you meet the above criteria, please submit your CV and a covering letter which outlines your experience and suitability to this role. Eligible applicants must be a Permanent Resident or have legal rights to work in Australia. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 15 business days of their application.

         Demonstrated knowledge of business analysis techniques and project methodologies         Experience in business analysis practices including process modelling         Ability to clearly articulate complex topics to a wide audience         Strong understanding of IT systems and operational data privacy requirements         Strong understanding of Australian and New Zealand privacy legislation         Advanced skills in Microsoft Office including Excel, Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Word         Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels

Proven experience with data privacy or data      management/governance initiatives

To that end, it is a requirement that our employees be vaccinated, and it’s an inherent requirement for the successful candidate for this role to be vaccinated.

About the Role
We are seeking an enthusiastic Applications & Data Analyst to join our Systems team and work across application support and creation of visualisation assets for the wider business. The role will be responsible for: 

Liaising with users and senior management to collect visualisation requirements
Developing easy to use and visually compelling dashboards in Tableau
Building interactive dashboards which provide insights that can be easily interpreted by stakeholders
Collaborating with operations teams to develop and maintain performance metrics, measurements, methods, and targets
Identifying patterns and meaningful insights from data through qualitative and quantitative analysis
Developing training material and facilitating end user application training
Managing day to day support of application incidents and data requests from the business
Balancing a dynamic workload across a broad range of projects in an agile environment

Position Details

Initial 6 month fixed term contract with potential for ongoing opportunity
Located in Lewisham

What can we offer you?

A progressive and people focused culture
Opportunities for professional development
Access to salary packaging of expenses up to a cap of $15,900 plus other uncapped benefits
Employee Assistance Program (free confidential counselling for you and your family)

About You
To be a successful candidate for this role you will have:

The ability to undertake the duties of the role in accordance with CatholicCare’s Mission, Vision and Values and its Code of Ethics and Conduct
Relevant tertiary qualification in Technology or Finance
A minimum of 2 years’ experience with front end reporting & data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI and Excel
Proficiency in SQL and/or Tableau experience is advantageous
Proven ability to understand complex data models, manipulate large datasets, perform in-depth analysis, and present the data and findings that are easily understood by technical and non-technical audiences
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns and insights from data. 

How to Apply?

About Us
CatholicCare Sydney is a leading not-for-profit agency providing care and support to people in Sydney across a wide range of social services: Children and families, relationships, ageing, disability, employment, mental health and youth programs. We are the official social services agency of the Catholic Archdiocese of Sydney.
At CatholicCare, we believe vaccination to be the best way to keep our people and our communities safe from Covid-19. We require all employees, volunteers and students to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of engagement
CatholicCare requires the preferred applicant to undertake a National Criminal History Record Check prior to employment and may also require a Working with Children Check.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer:  People of Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and other culturally & linguistically diverse backgrounds and people living with a disability are encouraged to apply.

Full time, permanent opportunity based in Sydney, NSW
Use your data analyst skills for good
Work for the world's largest humanitarian movement

About Australian Red Cross
Red Cross are part of one of the largest humanitarian movements in the world seeking to build a better society based on people helping people.
We have a focus on understanding all of the connections people have with us and how to make this connection a richer more rewarding experience.
Key to achieving an exceptional experience is data science. Our supporters and customers interact with us and with each other in a myriad of ways, whether it is through donations, membership, shopping in our stores, volunteering or online social networks.
We are looking to leverage data science to create a more profoundly personalised and impactful experience.
The Australian Red Cross Data Science and Analytics team is an award-winning innovative team that values diversity, equity and inclusion.
About the role
Reporting to the Data Scientist, you will provide reporting, data and analysis support to the Engagement and Support Department, especially supporting the development and delivery of improved reporting capability, reporting, analytics, data mining, data extract management and process automation.
Working in partnership with the Fundraising, Customer Experience, Marketing and Communications, Retail and First Aid teams, you will deliver and improve on existing reporting architecture, practices and support.
With an understanding of business imperatives, you will work with the business to develop fit for purpose Analytics and BI solutions, as well as prototype the development of new business capability in the area.
What you will bring

Hands-on experience of file extracts from relational databases (expert level proficiency in SQL)
Hands-on experience in dynamic business report creation using modern BI tools (skills in Power-BI would be advantageous)
Application of Business Intelligence Tools and understanding of Data-warehousing principals
Demonstrated experience of data manipulation and exploration in SQL, data analysis, customer profiling and application of statistical methods
Experience in documenting databases, business rules and business reporting requirements
Exposure to Project Management principles and knowledge of SDLC
Experience in providing Analytics support to Strategic teams using both financial and customer data
Strong communication and presentation skills to explain complex data insights to non-technical decision-makers

We utilise Covid-19 safe practices
We encourage all of our employees to be vaccinated against Covid-19 and a number of states have mandated that Australian Red Cross employees must be vaccinated to perform work for us. Please make sure that you are able to comply with these government requirements or have the appropriate medical exemption information available.
Why work with us?
Use your data analyst skills for good and know that the work you do will help Red Cross improve outcomes for vulnerable people. Red Cross offers generous salary packaging benefits and flexible working arrangements.
You can access flexible working arrangements and generous salary packaging options that can increase your take home pay by paying certain expenses using pre-tax dollars up to $15,900 a year.
For further information
For further information, please view the position description attached below.
For additional enquiries, please contact Mahendra Samarawickrama on 02 8651 8843.

A marketing agency with data science at its core to provide empirically backed solutions to its clients? Okay, this is some legit stuff. Based in Cannon Hill this tribe of intelligent, passionate and collaborative folks are doing some big things with some big names in market. From identifying trends, strategise and influencing their client’s customers, customer driven data is truly the heart and centre of everything they do. From ongoing successful campaigns with their existing clients a number of projects have now come across their table where they are looking for data-passionate geeks to solve some tricky and complex problems with them. The CompanyWhilst data is at the centre of everything they do, the why is probably the coolest part about this team. Without giving the same spiel about the no lame people policy that I think any place would generally hold in high regard, this couldn’t be truer just due to how the team operates. Complex data problems varying from industries to sizes from medium to large enterprise businesses are a daily, ever changing occurrence in this place where it requires everyone to collaborate to find the solution. What you’ll find here are genuinely lovely people working together rather than Mr. “I’m always right”- McStain who just sits in the corner and is just a general downer, tells you his way is the “only way” and kinda kills the whole vibe/your soul. The WorkThis is an agency environment so you will be hands on with multiple projects creating processes utilising multiple data streams. You will extract raw data from numerous source systems, model, design and develop databases and work closely with cross-disciplined teams to solve problems and present the best solutions back to clients. The TechSELECT * FROM Engineers WHERE skills =  2-4 years SQL experience, ideally MySQL / Postgres ETL platforms (CloverDX, DataStage, Informatica, SSIS, Talend, Pentaho) Bash, Python, Perl, PHP Sound understanding of HTTP APIs Experience in data migration methodology, phased implementation plans, version control, technical documentation and testing  What’s in it for you  Training budget Flexible work times (core hours are 9 to 3 each day) Café on-site and indoor putt putt! 5-minute walk from Cannon Hill train station  Keen to learn more? Let’s jump on a call and chat! Kayla Lombard kayla.lombard@affix.com.au

M) and SharePoint preferred 3+ years’ hands-on experience with third-party applications like, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Adobe Target and Adobe Experience Manager 3+ years’ people management cleansing strategies Strong global mindset and cultural awareness as you will be working in a diverse firm with different backgrounds, professional experiences, cultures and working styles  You are About Shell Energy    Shell Energy is Australia’s largest dedicated supplier of business electricity. We deliver business energy solutions and innovation across a portfolio of gas, electricity, environmental products and energy productivity for commercial and industrial customers.  This has afforded us a ranking of number 1 in customer satisfaction in business electrical retailers for 10 years running, something that we are immensely proud of and aim to achieve in the future.  We also operate 662 megawatts of gas-fired peaking power stations in Western Australia and Queensland, supporting the transition to renewables, and are currently developing the 120-megawatt Gangarri solar energy development in Queensland.    About the Role:    The Pricing Analyst is responsible for managing the flow of customer pricing requests across all Shell Energy Retail target markets, including Commercial & Industrial Electricity, Gas and Small-Medium Enterprise (SME) Electricity.    Main Responsibilities:  Ensure that Energy Retail is able to promptly and efficiently respond to pricing requests; Development and maintenance of pricing and related models; Preparation and verification of pricing using in house tools and models; Maintenance of records relating to pending, live and expired customer quotes; Regularly review the competitiveness of offerings and amend as required; Analytical review and manipulation of data to ensure maximisation of profitability through application of sales margins, while still maintaining competitiveness; Vetting of price requests to ensure potential customers will provide economic benefit to the company and rejecting poor fits as appropriate; Liaising with the trading team to ensure that pricing remains profitable in the event of substantial market movements; Product development and analysis as required, which may involve liaison with multiple areas of the business; Lead the product and pricing quoting and billing establishment for customers; Manage the product setup, construct and price modelling for new tariffs as required; Ensure that Shell Energy remain compliant by maintaining regulatory, comparator and Shell Energy websites and all other pricing related collateral with the most current information.  About you:  Knowledge or experience with the National Electricity Market (NEM) is desirable but not essential; (VBA) /SQL would be highly regarded; Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and knowledge of Visual Basic Application An analytical ability to assess and quantify risks; Excellent attention to detail; Ability to perform under pressure and deliver commercially sound outcomes; and Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Excellent organisational skills and time management; Ability to work autonomously as well as within a team.  Why join us?    At Shell Energy we really value our culture and the way we work together to get stuff done. The work environment is Agile and fast-paced, with a strong emphasis on outcomes. We offer employees a great range of benefits including a competitive incentive program, generous leave benefits including flexible and supporting ways of working and state-of-the-art technology and facilities.  We are an equal opportunity employer and recognise the value in having a diverse workforce.  We strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees.    For more information, head to our website https://shellenergy.com.au

Reporting to the Regional Commercial Director, this role is responsible for providing financial insights, operational and analytical support to the Mars Food procurement team. The analysis and information provided, is used to manage market risks and optimize Value leadership ideas and programs.  This is a great role to utilise your aptitude for understanding complex systems and data sources and provides a great mix of commercial and technical responsibilities. What are we looking for?Tertiary qualifications in Commerce/Accounting or similar Very high attention to detail with demonstrated ability to critically analyse complex data & produce practical and usable information for strategic decision makingAbility to work under pressure in a dynamic environment Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skillsDemonstrated skills in Microsoft Office Suite with very high proficiency in ExcelExperience with SAP, Ariba & Power BI reporting toolsWhat would be your key responsibilities?Provide analytical support to the procurement team in continuous improvement projects including spend analysis, savings calculations, should cost analysis and management reportingBuild and maintain tools & reporting to facilitate Purchase Price forecasting variance Model, tracking associated value leadership activities (>5% delivery)Monitor the spend trend and perform analysis on data from various sources to identify improvement opportunities or potential issuesProvide reporting on procurement performance including gathering and presenting data on functional KPI’s;collecting and analysing supplier related dataAssisting in establishing pricing and performance standards through contracts with suppliersAbout us:What do MARS®, SNICKERS®, EXTRA®, ECLIPSE®, PEDIGREE®, WHISKAS®, DOLMIO®, MASTERFOODS ® and ROYAL CANIN® have in common? Work to continually improve organisational systems and processes
