We are looking for Senior Evaluators + Researchers to join our growing team in Melbourne!Are you looking to contribute to work that makes a difference to people’s lives? Our company purpose is to mobilise passionate and capable people to tackle the challenges facing our society – are you our next team member?About usAllen + Clarke is an Australasian consultancy group. Our company purpose is to “…mobilise passionate and capable people to tackle the challenges facing society”. We are a successful company that is committed to making a difference.We provide evaluation, research, policy, regulatory, business change and secretariat services to government, private sector and not-for-profit clients. We operate across Australia, New Zealand, the Pacific, and Asia.  We are well-recognised as a leader in evaluation and research services: our clients come to us for trusted advice on a wide range of issues. The opportunityWe are looking for Senior Evaluators and/or Researchers to join our team in Melbourne. As a senior consultant with us you will lead and contribute to a range of evaluation and research projects. Working closely with other consultants across Allen + Clarke, you will have the opportunity to be involved in many challenging and rewarding issues.The work we do ranges from completing rapid reviews of stand-alone programs or projects, specific data collection or analysis tasks, through to multi-year evaluations of complex and complicated policies and suites of programs. We are experts in a full range of qualitative and quantitative techniques and tools.About youWe want to hear from you if you:have 10+ years’ experience undertaking high quality evaluations or research studies in Australiahave extensive knowledge of a range of evaluation and research methods and approacheshave existing networks and links with government, NGOs and other evaluation practitionershave the ability to plan, manage and see high-quality projects through from inception to completionenjoy a challenge and grappling with complexity thrive on working with clients to identify their needs and deliverablescan lead projects, manage multiple pieces of work at once and work successfully within a teamWe are keen to hear from candidates with strong quantitative skills (we want to hear from qual people too but quantitative skills will be looked upon favourably).You will also have excellent, oral and written communications, including the ability to present information clearly and concisely.What we offerThis is an ongoing, full time role based in Melbourne and may require some domestic and international travel.  We offer flexible working arrangements.We will provide a supportive, collaborative and collegial work environment with opportunities to  mentor less experienced team members and to develop your consultancy skills alongside other experienced practitioners.We are committed to providing a supportive and culturally safe working environment for all our staff members, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employees. You can find out more about us at www.allenandclarke.com.au.   How to applyApplications close 5pm Monday 21 February 2022.Applicants should provide a cover letter and a succinct curriculum vitae or resume of no more than 4 pages. If you have any questions, please contact recruitment@allenandclarke.com.au or Kylie Berg, Director Business Development + Systems on 0418901876

Job Title: Research Project Officer/Genomic Data Analyst - Cotton Biotechnology
multiple_details: AU$87K to AU$111K pa + up to 15.4% superannuation
Description: Acknowledgement of Country CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.   The Opportunity Merge plant biology with bioinformatics & statistical modelling to support cotton research Great flexible work arrangements – full-time work from home option available! Be part of the supportive team at CSIRO – Australia’s National Science Agency! CSIRO Agriculture & Food unit is currently seeking a motivated Research Project Officer, with well-developed data modelling & programming skills, to join their Cotton Fibre Quality team.  At CSIRO, we take pride in our pioneering Cotton research from seed to shirt! With 100 per cent of Australian cotton grown from CSIRO varieties, we're adding value at all levels of the Australian cotton industry, including molecular biology, plant breeding, crop management and post-harvest processing. As the Research Project Officer, you will play a critical role in developing capability that brings together plant biology and bioinformatics & statistical modelling to enhance a genomic selection breeding platform in cotton. You will be part of an expert team of scientists who will provide support in cotton fibre biology & molecular biology, bioinformatics, statistics, and modelling. They work towards supporting a profitable and sustainable cotton industry through biotechnology. In this computer-based role, you will have a focus on building various data models and testing the use of existing transcript data & gene networks to improve genomic predictions for fibre quality.   This will be an excellent role for a driven data modeller/analyst, with an interest in the field of agriculture, to work on exciting research projects. Flexible work arrangements are on offer, including the option to work full-time from home/remotely.  Applications are invited across two job classification levels and the successful candidate will be appointed at the level commensurate with their skills and experience.   Your duties will include: Analysing and interrogating large data sets of genome and transcript sequences. Identifying markers for cotton fibre quality traits. Using programming language for bioinformatics (e.g., R and/or Python) to manipulate genome-wide data, build statistical models and inform models for fibre quality. Applying statistical and/or machine learning methods for fibre quality in the current cotton Genomic Selection Project pipeline. Identifying genes or gene clusters as potential targets for modelling or gene editing. At the higher job classification level, you will also be independently designing and driving project activity direction in line with project milestones. Location: Black Mountain, ACT (preferred) or Remote/Work From Home Salary: AU$87K to AU$111K pa (pro-rata for part-time) + up to 15.4% superannuation Tenure: Specified Term until 30 June 2023 Reference: 81060   To be considered you will need: Relevant trade certificate/diploma/bachelor’s degree, or equivalent relevant work experience, in Biology or Data Analytics. Skills in bioinformatics e.g., interrogating genome-data-sets. Skills in building and/or using statistical models, such as linear regression and linear mixed models. Knowledge and experience using programming language for bioinformatics, such as R and/or Python. For appointment at the higher job classification level, the additional essential criteria will also include:  Demonstrated ability to communicate project outcome results to diverse teams. Proven leadership skills and ability to lead a project to a successful outcome. For full details about this role please review the  Position Description.   Eligibility To be eligible to apply for this role, you must be currently residing in Australia as an:  Australian/New Zealand Citizen Australian Permanent Resident Australian Temporary Resident, with an existing valid visa and unrestricted work rights for the duration of the term (until July 2023), without any requirement for visa sponsorship from CSIRO. The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent and may be subject to other security/medical/character check requirements.   Flexible Working Arrangements We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.    Diversity and Inclusion We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.    About CSIRO At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.  Join us and start creating tomorrow today!   How to Apply Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.   Applications Close 13 February 2022, 11:00pm AEDT

• Flexible working arrangements
• Work with a range of multi-functional teams
• Full-time permanent opportunity
Make a better tomorrow.When you join the team at Synergy, you’re becoming part of Western Australia’s intelligent energy future. We are proud to be the state’s largest energy provider, striving for an efficient and sustainable power supply with the latest innovations in energy usage and storage. Working for Synergy means you’ll play an important role in ensuring that WA is a world-leader in how our customers choose to use, store and trade energy for years to come.Synergy’s focus is the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and the environment in which we operate. You’ll find our core values of innovation, collaboration, accountability and trust are integrated into the culture of every team and the way we do business with our customers, our people and our suppliers. Building tomorrow’s energy future is a big job, and it’s why we only look for the very best people to join us.An exciting opportunity has become available to join the Asset Optimisation team based at our Head Office on St Georges Tce, Perth on a full-time permanent basis. Your main priority will be to maintain and improve the consistency and accuracy of master data for our SAP system to facilitating safe and efficient work planning and maintenance processes for our generation assets.We’re looking for inspiring people who will:Maintain GBU SAP master data standards for generating plant assetMaintain GBU procedures and templates suitable for managing the change of SAP PM dataHave control of SAP PM master data governanceAnalyse and recommend appropriate procedures to the business regarding SAP PM data modificationsCreate and develop training material suitable for training personnel in the SAP asset master data change processes and standardsAudit and report SAP PM data errors and omissionsAdvise and influence SAP end users to ensure all changes maintain the integrity and consistency of SAP master dataAnalyse and recommend SAP data requirements to Capex projects to ensure master data supplied with new equipment and plant conforms to Synergy standardsOur ideal candidate will possess the following experience and attributes:Background of trades, inventory/maintenance planners and/or data analystsMinimum 5 years’ experience in SAP ERP production environment.All-encompassing understanding of SAP PM technical objectsDemonstrable experience of SAP PM technical objects like functional location master & scheduling maintenance plansKnowledge of SAP procurement function such as Outline Agreements, Service Masters and ContractsHighly Desirable:Qualifications in SAP Plant Maintenance, Basics skills in Internet Applications, MS Office (especially Excel) and WinshuttleLocated in the heart of the Perth CBD, our offices are appointed with free wellness and leisure facilities, including a pool, gym and bike storage areas. You’re always just minutes from a huge variety of great food options, spectacular King’s Park, convenient public transport options and the best shopping destinations that the city has to offer. Working for an employer of choice in the energy sector means that you’ll also enjoy security and benefits above and beyond many other companies. Of course, Synergy is also an equal opportunity employer, committed to developing an equitable and diverse workforce. We always encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, and people of all diverse backgrounds to apply.Working for an employer of choice also means you will enjoy:Life Insurance (equivalent to 2 years’ salary)Discounted Health Insurance with Bupa, Medibank and HBFEmployee recognition programsProfessional Development Opportunities, including training, memberships and study assistancePurchase Annual Leave – purchase an additional 2 weeks of annual leave per financial yearSocial club and community engagement opportunitiesParental Leave optionsPlease submit your CV by clicking the “Apply” button below. Successful applicants will be required to submit a National Police Check dated within the past 12 months and complete a medical check. Applications close 5pm, 11th Feb 2022.For technical assistance with your application, please email recruitment@synergy.net.au. Please note, applications will not be accepted via this email address. To find out more about our community projects and initiatives, please visit https://www.synergy.net.au/Our-energy/For-our-communitySynergy reserves the right to commence the shortlisting process at its discretion. Direct applicants only - we will not be accepting agency-referred applications.Tomorrow can’t wait.

Job Title: SEO Specialist / Team Lead - Award Winning Agency
Description: Are you an experienced Search Marketing / SEO Manager looking to work with leading brands at an established, fast-growing full service digital agency? Do you approach your work with a transparent, results orientated philosophy?If this sounds like you, let's talk! We’re Atlas. We think differently, we’re innovative, strategic, creative, technically advanced and create integrated digital solutions for our clients that get results.We love what we do, we do what it takes to deliver greater value and achieve the very best outcomes. We’re an ambitious, progressive, professional, fun and down-to-earth bunch who love what we do and value our inclusive, supportive culture.Over the past decade, we’ve worked with some of the biggest brands and organisations to drive change and exceptional growth through performance digital marketing, web development, app development, content production and the latest cutting edge technologies.We are now moving into AI, VR, AR and programmatic marketing at a rapid rate.Our client list includes some of Australia’s leading entertainment, retailers, corporates, many of which we have worked with for many years.  We’re looking for a SEO Manager / Team Lead to join our growing team. Could it be you?We are an innovative, full service agency with offices in Sydney, Melbourne & Brisbane. We have recently won a swag of awards in the areas of web, social media & online advertising and now we want to bring even more success to our team and clients, as we grow and evolve.This is a full time position, for a passionate, down to earth, fun, energetic and professional person seeking that next exciting move with real career growth opportunities. Our team is fun & supportive, we are just as focused on the best solutions and outcomes for our clients as we are about personal development and investing in our teams personal growth.Our ideal candidate is a self-starter who is familiar with the digital & agency landscape, is passionate about great work and has strong account service skills. You are well presented, a great communicator and enjoy sharing and learning with a team. THE ROLEAs an SEO/SEM Manager you will work closely with the teams to make a positive impact on our clients' brands, the team and our agency. You have a genuine passion for digital marketing - and you're looking for that next great step in your career with career growth opportunities. You willHave been working on SEO/SEM projects for up to 2-3 yearsBe Google Certified and more (or prepared to get trained)Have have a proven track record of successHave worked in a similar role, preferably an agency environmentAre an excellent communicator and love peoplePossibly managed a team of SEO specialists or worked within a team of digital marketers Day to day you will work within and manage the search team;Plan and manage the search marketing teams work within the broader digital marketing teamPaid search; Google Adwords, PPC, SEM, YouTube Ads and possibly socials as wellManaging landing pages and websites to install code and pixelsSetup, management and optimisation of campaignsConfiguring Google Analytics for accurate data collectionSEO (Indexing, Content and Keyword research)SEM (Quality Score, Ad variation, Keyword research)Creating all the types of google ads (Display, Shopping and Search)Html, CSS and JavaScriptCreating the best bidding strategy for maximising conversionsCreating content marketing strategies to support SEO objectives.Analysing analytics to identify areas of opportunity and utilise conversion rate optimisation tacticsReviewing analytics and data analysis to produce insightful reportsExtracting and presenting insights to internal and external stakeholdersPrepare performance analysis reports and make recommendations for corrective modifications with a view to ongoing optimisationReport on team performance, and work with senior management to guide the team through performance reviews, training and development. EXPERIENCEYou are proficient in the main SEO softwares; google search console, google analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, etc.Experience with the analysis of site architecture, on-page/on-site environments, content and navigation structures and identify strong / weak pointsMonitor SEO performance daily by using SEO tools available (Google Analytics, Search Console, Tag manager etc) and optimise using dataGoogle Analytics set-up for clientsImplement and manage keywords, bid strategies, budgets, impressions and ROITrack, report, and analyse website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaignsPerform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimisationResearch and analyse competitor advertising linksDevelop and implement link building strategy with the ability to improve domain ratingsWork with digital marketing team and Heads of Departments to drive SEO in content creation and content programmingReview analytics to identify areas of opportunityYou may have experience in CMS’s like; Wordpress, Shopify, UmbracoYou may have experience with Hubspot, Marketo or SalesforceYou have a great work ethic, be a good communicator and a team playerYou are well presented and take pride in yourself and your work PERKS AND BENEFITSFlexible Work DaysBirthday Day off & Volunteer time offMental Health Leave & 2 x Atlas FY Days offHealthy & Fun Work EnvironmentCompany Boat days & Agency social eventsStocked kitchen and barAtlas Brand SwagCareer Advancement opportunitiesTraining & Development TO APPLYPlease apply through cover letter and CV, only if you have the skills and qualifications outlined.Only those applicants who are shortlisted will be notified.Candidates must be eligible to work in AustraliaRemuneration is a logical consequence of candidate’s fit and experience.

Integrity Systems Company (ISC) develops, delivers and administers integrity programs and applications for the meat and livestock industry.  ISC is in the enviable position of being able to collaborate with industry experts on projects that range from modern progressive web applications to large scale IoT networks and sensors, drones, robotics, spatial data, machine learning and data visualisation, and other cutting-edge industry research that will underpin red meat integrity in the future. ISC is a fully owned subsidiary of Meat and Livestock Australia (MLA). ISC have a rewarding role for an experienced and talented individual to join the team as their Data Analyst based in Sydney.As ISC Data Analyst, you will own ISC and MLA’s data catalogue and be responsible for the sourcing, curation, cataloguing and analysis of ISC, MLA and red meat supply chain data. You will bring fresh ideas and work in collaboration with research, adoption and product teams in interpreting trends and patterns in data sets. Key accountabilities of the role include:Work within the ISC/MLA businesses and with red meat industry supply chain stakeholders to identify, document, curate and catalogue core datasets identifying data gaps and opportunitiesAnalysing information using statistical/data analysis techniques, and developing models for analysis where relevant. Ensuring ongoing data integrity and reporting any data inconsistencies.Provide timely data and data visualisation support across project teams, with respect to extracting, preparing and storing data, and transforming or manipulating data to prepare outputsAssist with the quality assurance, enhancement, linking and enrichment of ISC and MLA’s dataWork with the red meat supply chain to provide data and analytic supportAssist in the analysis, design and development of solutions for automation and/or streamlining of ISC, MLA and industry data collectionTransform data using analytical tools and software such as Excel, R, Python, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to ISC and MLA’s assetsTune and optimise analytics and queriesPrepare reports and data analysis using Tableau, Microsoft BI, MicroStrategy and Splunk Desired Skills and ExperienceThe successful candidate will have:Relevant tertiary qualification in data science, mathematics, statistics, econometrics, computer scienceBe comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics softwareBe familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R, Python, SQL and SSRSHave critical thinking and problem-solving skills and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, Microsoft environments, Unix/Linux environments, mobile application development, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software developmentWorking proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written EnglishExperience working with data catalogue softwareExperience using Tableau, Splunk, MicroStrategy, Microsoft BI or other data visualisation software Why work for ISC? We aim to provide a modern and flexible work environment for our employees, complemented by benefits that promote overall employee wellbeing, including rebateable salary packaging, wellbeing events, rewards and recognition and a fun culture driven by our social club. Interested? Apply now via the link below to view the full position description. Applications must include a resume and a cover letter (of no more than two pages) addressing the selection criteria. If you have questions in relation to the advertised position contact the Human Resources team by emailing careers@mla.com.au Applications close: 11 February 2022Candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the advertisement

Our opportunity:UnitingCare is seeking an experienced Principal Data Assurance Specialist to join our Internal Audit team. Reporting to the Group Internal Audit Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the Internal Audit and Risk and Assurance functions, to use data to provide assurance over UnitingCare’s key controls. This will include identifying, designing, executing and reporting on data for auditing, risk-based exercises, and process improvement opportunities. Please note, this is a full time, permanent role. Key responsibilities:Identify, coordinate and lead the identification of opportunities to use data in the assessment of overall risk and internal controls, and identify areas for simplification and process improvement. Drive the development and evaluation of data analytics using Highbond and PowerBI. Develop a detailed understanding of extracting raw data, data mapping, and data flows across UnitingCare source systems. Perform trend analysis over raw data to derive meaningful insights and information presented in the form of reports and dashboards. Normalise and maintain the integrity and quality of data in Risk and Assurance analytics systems and project deliverables. Develop and maintain the repository of analysis and dashboards developed and executed as part of the Risk and Assurance data analytics program. Partner with the broader Risk and Assurance team to train and build expertise in data analysis concepts and tools. Develop a Risk and Assurance Data Analytics Strategy, ensuring that Risk and Assurance analytics systems are designed and managed to meet the requirements of this strategy. Your skills & experience:Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field.Minimum of 5 years’ experience working in a data analytics, programming or internal audit role, with experience in utilising dashboarding tools (PowerBI, Tableau), analytics applications (Highbond) and query structures (SQL, Oracle).Proven ability to translate information into actionable outcomes to drive business performance and the ability to process complex datasets and transform them into business decisionsStrong stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to communicate technical information at all levels. Please Note: To ensure the health and safety of our people, and the clients, residents, patients and people we serve at UnitingCare Queensland, individuals are required to comply with statutory and Government requirements, such as public health directions, and UnitingCare's vaccination requirements policy, with respect to COVID-19 vaccinations. What we offer:With over 17,500 employees and 9,000 volunteers, UnitingCare is the largest Not-For-Profit provider of health, aged & community services in Queensland and one of the largest employers in the state. We believe in unique and holistic care, prioritising the individual to nurture physical, mental and spiritual well-being.Not-for-profit salary packaging options: allocate up to $15,900 of your pre-taxable income to everyday expenses, increasing take-home pay.One-on-one support from pastoral care team & employee assistance programs.Retail, Health Insurance and Gym Membership Discounts.Access to non-taxable meal & entertainment card.Hospital admissions discounts.Additional paid parental leave, education leave & additional leave purchases.Flexible work environments, including working from home options. Ready to work together:To apply for this opportunity, please click on the 'Apply' button below to be taken to our online application process. Applying will take you around 15 minutes where you’ll be asked for a Cover Letter and Resume. Our approach is simple – everybody is welcome here. At UnitingCare, diversity is at the core of our who we are, our mission and our values. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees no matter their sex, race, culture, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity. We know that when our people feel respected and valued, we empower them to share that within the communities we serve and to provide the very best care. We highly encourage applications from people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander.

We provide an environment and culture that helps our people live well and enjoy a meaningful life, at work and at home. We’re serious about helping people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Exchange for Change is a purpose-driven company who is passionate about sustainability. We are the coordinator of the NSW and ACT container deposit schemes. We are proud to be a trusted partner that collaborates with government, industry, and communities to deliver these schemes which make a difference to the lives of people by realising environmental, social, and economic benefits.  We are looking for a dynamic IT Business Analyst, 6 months contract role to join our team! The purpose of the role is to work on the implementation and improvement of varied systems. This business partnership position acts as a technical go-between working with Users to understand business requirements and Support Partners to deliver solutions ensuring that Users, get a hassle-free IT experience. You will bring your technical knowledge to help shape the future working environment of Exchange for Change as we try to make work as efficient and seamless as possible and improve customer experience.  Key Responsibilities:  Being the first point of call for user issues, guiding them to possible solutions or the right support partner  Helping to debug and test solutions  Acting as a User Advocate to get solutions quickly  Working with Users, researching and assessing current processes, technologies, and systems to understand pain points and challenges to overcome.  Analyse and document business requirements to inform the development of Functional Specifications and gain user acceptance.  Working with third-party support partners, ensure optimum solution designs capture Functional Specifications by performing a thorough analysis with key stakeholders.  Working with Support Partners to derive Technical Specifications that meet Functional Specifications, including system, data, and testing requirements  Manage projects including planning and reporting progress with project stakeholders.  Ensure users are engaged and equipped to use products being delivered through technology training and coaching, developing training documentation, and quick reference guides.  Working with the Performance and Systems Manager to monitor performance of Support Partners and improve working relationships, maintain a clear roadmap for the IT environment and support the delivery of the IT Strategy    The ideal candidate:  You will have strong communication and relationship-building skills which will allow you to work closely with a wide range of stakeholders including business leaders, execs, colleagues, and external government departments. You will also possess strong leadership skills and exceptional technical ability.   Have strong governance capabilities with a rigorous approach to process management and attention to detail.  You thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment and are excited about achieving real behaviour change that makes an impact Experience:   Experience or certification in business and systems analysis  Experience in business systems implementation and integration  User Story Definition  Strong communication skills and track record of stakeholder engagement   User Interface / User Experience (UI/UX) definition  Experience or certification in project management and change management  Technical experience or certification in some or all of the following would be an advantage:   Microsoft Azure, Windows, Sharepoint, Teams, Outlook  Confluence and Jira  Oracle PaaS (Content and Experience Cloud, Autonomous Data Warehouse, Analytics)  Oracle SaaS (ERP, CX Sales and Service, Eloqua)  DNS Services and Web Hosting  IT Security Principles (ISO270001)  Flexible working arrangements are important to us at Exchange for Change. Remote First is an initiative we are proud to introduce to support our team’s requirements. Our team is diverse, passionate, friendly, and we offer plenty of room for growth. Apply now to be part of a purpose-driven company that is making a positive difference. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Located at Ultimo Campus
About TAFE NSW
TAFE NSW is the largest skills and training provider in Australia, and one of the largest in the world. We strive to deliver relevant, high quality, practical and creative training designed to equip the workforce of tomorrow, and to grow the NSW economy.
We are seeking experienced and qualified candidates who share the TAFE NSW Values of Integrity, Collaboration, Excellence and Customer First values, and who will contribute to our commitment towards building an innovative culture.
The Opportunity
Working within the Strategy and Research Unit, the Planning Research Analyst will undertake research to support with industry and skills needs analysis to inform service delivery planning and the development of skills strategies. The position is responsible for analysing the changing nature of skills and future demand for training, as well as industry and economic developments to identify training growth opportunities, generate recommendations and provide planning advice to support decision making. The position analyses jobs and skills data to identify trends, draw insights and determines the implications for TAFE NSW. The role also supports coordination of inputs to the planning process and supports in the development of planning tools and frameworks.
About you
To succeed in this role, you will have an analytical mindset and will be able to use exceptional critical thinking, research, and creativity skills to identify training opportunities within a rapidly growing environment characterised by technological disruption, sector reforms and competition. You will have sound analytical skills to conduct in-depth research and data analysis on the vocational education and training market, and broader education landscape. Exceptional written communication skills are essential to provide expert advice and recommendations to executive leadership and to present data insights and findings in a user-friendly manner.
Additional Requirements
Degree qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent industry experience to the role.
Demonstrated expertise in understanding research and analysing data using multiple sources and drawing meaningful insights and providing advice to support planning and decision making.
Proven expertise in using Microsoft Office suite (including Advanced Microsoft Excel) and analytical and visualisation methods.
Excellent communication skills and demonstrated skills in identifying trends, making actionable recommendations and producing comprehensive reports.
For full details on the role and application process, please see the Position Description and Information Package.
How to Apply
For your application to be considered, you must complete the following:-
Attach your latest resume detailing suitability for the role and a cover letter outlining your interest.
Respond to the two targeted questions (max 300 words in response)
Role Inquiries - Please contact Sarah Midgley, Manager Research and Planning on 9217 4216 or sarah.midgley@tafensw.edu.au 
Recruitment Enquiries - Joanne Albronda, Talent Acquisition Advisor via email joanne.albronda@tafensw.edu.au 
Closing Date -  Wednesday 24 November 2021, 11:59pm.

 9. Ensure security and authentication are to DCDD standards.
 


Requirements

 The candidate will have the following skills and experience: 
 





 1. Experience with Data Warehouse implementations.
 





 2. Significant experience of working as an ETL/BI Developer/Lead in a large enterprise wide environment with large and complex datasets using Microsoft Data and Analytics Suite of products
 





 3. Demonstrated extensive experience (at least 7 years) in a software development role on complex, large scale projects or programs.
 





 4. Highly skilled in programming, C# .Net.
 





 5. Demonstrated skill with web development (HTML/CSS/JavaScript).
 





 6. Strong experience with data migration planning and execution.
 





 7. Strong experience with data cleansing activities.
 





 8. Industry experience with database analysis and design practices.
 





 9. Experience with developing ETL scripts.
 





 10. Experience developing reconciliation scripts/reports
 





 11. Demonstrated understanding of SQL Server Reporting Services
 





 12. Ability to analyse and document system interfaces, data and workflow processes, using industry standard techniques.
 





 13. Experience with designing, creating, deploying and managing data architecture.
 





 14. Experience with developing and implementing enterprise scale reports and dashboards.
 





 15. Familiar with common technologies for data warehousing and ETL methodologies.
 





 16. Understanding of Power BI and Business Objects XI
 





 17. Scripting experience using SQL.
 





Benefits

 1. Opportunity to work with the Northern Territory Government.
 


 2. Relocation assistance available. 
 


 3. Excellent salary - we value experience. 
 


 4. Darwin CBD location, close to great places to eat. 
 


 5. ABN or PAYG options.

Job Title: Research Project Officer/Genomic Data Analyst - Cotton Biotechnology
multiple_details: AU$87K to AU$111K pa + up to 15.4% superannuation
Description: Acknowledgement of Country CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.   The Opportunity Merge plant biology with bioinformatics & statistical modelling to support cotton research Great flexible work arrangements – full-time work from home option available! Be part of the supportive team at CSIRO – Australia’s National Science Agency! CSIRO Agriculture & Food unit is currently seeking a motivated Research Project Officer, with well-developed data modelling & programming skills, to join their Cotton Fibre Quality team.  At CSIRO, we take pride in our pioneering Cotton research from seed to shirt! With 100 per cent of Australian cotton grown from CSIRO varieties, we're adding value at all levels of the Australian cotton industry, including molecular biology, plant breeding, crop management and post-harvest processing. As the Research Project Officer, you will play a critical role in developing capability that brings together plant biology and bioinformatics & statistical modelling to enhance a genomic selection breeding platform in cotton. You will be part of an expert team of scientists who will provide support in cotton fibre biology & molecular biology, bioinformatics, statistics, and modelling. They work towards supporting a profitable and sustainable cotton industry through biotechnology. In this computer-based role, you will have a focus on building various data models and testing the use of existing transcript data & gene networks to improve genomic predictions for fibre quality.   This will be an excellent role for a driven data modeller/analyst, with an interest in the field of agriculture, to work on exciting research projects. Flexible work arrangements are on offer, including the option to work full-time from home/remotely.  Applications are invited across two job classification levels and the successful candidate will be appointed at the level commensurate with their skills and experience.   Your duties will include: Analysing and interrogating large data sets of genome and transcript sequences. Identifying markers for cotton fibre quality traits. Using programming language for bioinformatics (e.g., R and/or Python) to manipulate genome-wide data, build statistical models and inform models for fibre quality. Applying statistical and/or machine learning methods for fibre quality in the current cotton Genomic Selection Project pipeline. Identifying genes or gene clusters as potential targets for modelling or gene editing. At the higher job classification level, you will also be independently designing and driving project activity direction in line with project milestones. Location: Black Mountain, ACT (preferred) or Remote/Work From Home Salary: AU$87K to AU$111K pa (pro-rata for part-time) + up to 15.4% superannuation Tenure: Specified Term until 30 June 2023 Reference: 81060   To be considered you will need: Relevant trade certificate/diploma/bachelor’s degree, or equivalent relevant work experience, in Biology or Data Analytics. Skills in bioinformatics e.g., interrogating genome-data-sets. Skills in building and/or using statistical models, such as linear regression and linear mixed models. Knowledge and experience using programming language for bioinformatics, such as R and/or Python. For appointment at the higher job classification level, the additional essential criteria will also include:  Demonstrated ability to communicate project outcome results to diverse teams. Proven leadership skills and ability to lead a project to a successful outcome. For full details about this role please review the  Position Description.   Eligibility To be eligible to apply for this role, you must be currently residing in Australia as an:  Australian/New Zealand Citizen Australian Permanent Resident Australian Temporary Resident, with an existing valid visa and unrestricted work rights for the duration of the term (until July 2023), without any requirement for visa sponsorship from CSIRO. The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent and may be subject to other security/medical/character check requirements.   Flexible Working Arrangements We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.    Diversity and Inclusion We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.    About CSIRO At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.  Join us and start creating tomorrow today!   How to Apply Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.   Applications Close 13 February 2022, 11:00pm AEDT

Company description:Queensland Rail's purpose is to provide a customer-focused, safe, reliable, on-time, value for money rail service that benefits the community, supports industry and is integrated with the public transport system. The organisation's vision is connecting communities through a modern, world-class rail service.Job description:We are a large and fully integrated infrastructure business chartered with a responsibility that is pivotal to the success of Queensland and its people. Our culture is one based around safety and performance. We currently have a 12 month fixed term opportunity for a data savvy individual to join our dynamic Advanced Analytics team in our Strategic Integrated Ops Planning and Assurance business area. In this role you will participate and lead the development of rail network and passenger analytics that aim to efficiently improve commercial, strategic, operational and public transport aspects of service delivery.  It is advised this role will require knowledge and willingness to learn coding languages. Strong stakeholder communications skills are critical in this role along with the ability to collate, analyse and translate data into meaningful reports and requirements so it is understood by various managers and staff within Queensland Rail. High level of skill in the use of railway micro simulation programs e.g. RailSys (RM Con) and the interpretation of outputs. High level of programming experience and the use of packages such as R and MATLAB, to manage data sets outputted from signalling systems, rollingstock telemetry and ticketing systems (Go-card) etcetera. High level of analytical, research, problem solving, data analysis and data visualisation  This position is not without its challenges, your ability to remain calm in an often adversarial, intense and fast paced environment along with your exceptional stakeholder communication skills and ability to prioritise and manage your time will ensure your success in this role. Starting salary: $96,090 + superannuation In addition to a generous superannuation scheme, Queensland Rail also offers free train travel to and from work on duty days and a healthy work/ life balance.   Profile description:If this position interests you and you feel you have the knowledge and experience please apply to Senior Data Scientist (2397) via our website by clicking onto the "Apply" button. Please submit a resume and covering letter outlining your relevant experience by 11:59pm Wednesday 9 February 2022 IMPORTANT NOTE: CURRENT QUEENSLAND RAIL EMPLOYEES  Queensland Rail employees must apply for vacancies via the People Connect solution and not via the external Queensland Rail career site or Seek using one of the following options:  1. While at home or on the go at anytime, anywhere using the People Connect Solution on a personal device not connected to the Queensland Rail IT network or LAN. Please note you will need to set up Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) on your account profile. There are two options to do this:  Install the Microsoft Authenticator app on your smartphone.  If your phone does not support the app, or you do not wish to use an app, you can authenticate by either an automated phone call or a 6-digit verification code received via a text message.   2. While at work signed via the People Connect solution (Single Sign On) using a Queensland Rail corporate device connected to the Queensland Rail IT network or LAN.  External applicants applying for roles within Queensland Rail will be subject to Alcohol and Other Drugs pre-employment testing. The recruitment and selection process for this position might require shortlisted applicants to undertake psychometric assessment, pre-employment health assessment and background checks that might also include criminal history and credit checks.   Queensland Rail embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way.  We have built the foundation for diversity in the areas of gender balance, First Nations Peoples, Youth, Disability and Multiculturalism. We continue to establish and integrate key programs such as QRWomen, Graduate and Apprentice Programs, Work and Welcome, Returned to Work processes, Employee Assistance Program, as well as Queensland Rail First Nations and LGBTIQ+ Staff Reference Groups. To learn more about this Queensland Rail career opportunity please contact Kristy Jordan with your specific enquiry on 1800 115 000 or email qrcareers@qr.com.au.  Please do not email your application. multiple_details: Enjoy a Flexi Day on us!
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. Now that we’ve successfully built one world-class entertainment company, we’re doubling our impact. We’re demerging, with a sharp focus on two new ASX listed companies: Lotteries & Keno Co, Australia’s leading lottery operator, and Wagering & Gaming Co, Australia’s largest diversified wagering operator and gaming services provider. For the next 12 months and beyond, we’re bringing the brightest minds together to go bigger and braver than ever. Game to join us?
Make it yours
*Demerger subject to shareholder, court, regulatory and other approvals. Company names are holding names only.
The purpose of this role is to scrutinise and verify Lottery, Keno and Promotional draws and assist with Assurance reviews. This is an exciting new role in our Lotteries and Keno Assurance Team and a great opportunity if you’re a graduate, looking for an organisation to kick start your career.
What you’ll do

Assist with planning, executing and reporting of consultative Assurance reviews;
Review and investigate Assurance CAAT exceptions, including transaction and fraud monitoring alerts;
Assist in the daily verification of Lottery and Keno draws as per regulatory and licensing requirements;
Assist in the scrutiny and validation of Promotional draws;
Assist in the validation of major prize payments; and
Provide independent appraisal of the controls relating to Instant Scratch-Its games.

What you’ll bring

Relevant tertiary-level qualification in commerce, information technology, business, law, economics or other related discipline;
Experience in an Assurance or Audit related job is desirable; and
Experience in understanding of Lottery and/or Keno products will be advantageous.

When you join Tabcorp, you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs. 
About Tabcorp 
We’re Australia’s largest gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill. 
Our 4,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing, Sky Sports Radio and MAX. As an ASX listed company we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible. 
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au 
You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.

Would you like to provide CX consulting services to some of  Australia's most successful brands?  Are you interested in using your experience in marketing automation and analytical mindset to help solve CX challenges?   Are you looking for a flexible WFH role, using best-in-class martech and reporting platforms? Take the next step in your career in 2022 by joining IVE Data-Driven Communications (IVE DDC) team of experienced Customer Experience specialists in this exciting, newly-created role! Apply for a confidential discussion today. Hybrid working conditions apply.IVE Data Driven Communications is a division of IVE Group, Australia's leading holistic marketing company (ASX:IGL). Driven by data, we provide deep customer insights and specialist marketing technology services. We then implement these through the creation, production, and delivery of targeted personalised communications, across every channel - physical and digital.  We unlock the power of data to give our clients a competitive advantage. IVE DDC is a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Gold Partner and an Adobe Campaign Partner organisation. We provide assistance to our clients with platform-agnostic customer experience, data and insights services which solve their most pressing customer experience and campaign challenges. The RoleReporting to the Director of Data & Personalisation, the newly-created Campaign Optimisation & Personalisation Consultant role is integral to helping IVE's clients maximise their ROI from their martech investments and data sources to deliver the best possible customer experience to their customers, while optimising the measurable outcomes from their campaign activities.This role will see you working hand-in-hand with clients to understand the nature of their Customer Experience challenges and opportunities, use data and custom reporting to craft observations and actionable insights, and work with campaign teams to implement your personalisation and campaign optimisation roadmap. Key responsibilities will include: Deliver CX consulting services, in-line with client requirements, targeting challenges and need Deliver CX consulting services to our broad portfolio of clients (retained clients & ad hoc services) in collaboration with the Director of Data & Personalisation Work with clients to assess the performance of their campaigns, and use data to develop test cases to increase engagement and improve measurable outcomes.  Work with cross-functional teams, both internal and client-side, to assist stakeholders in prioritising activities based on priority and CX impact, including implementing bespoke campaign optimisation roadmaps and managing innovation backlogs. Be the internal champion for personalisation and campaign optimisation.  Educate and support a broad range colleagues in communicating best practices to client stakeholders and new prospect accounts. To be successful in this role, you will have:  5+ years of hands-on relevant marketing automation experience using best-in-class marketing automation platforms (eg. Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Campaign, Marketo or Responsys), building always-on customer lifecycle journeys and triggered campaigns.  Experience in implementing campaign optimisation and A/B testing best practices. Experience working with cross-functional teams to deliver multi-channel lifecycle programs and tactical campaigns.  Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, with an ability to share your passions for customer experience excellence and data-driven insights.  You are a self-starter, curious by nature, and enjoy using data to confirm hypotheses.  You have the ability to independently manipulate data (either in Excel, or reporting platforms such as Power BI/Tableau) to uncover impactful insights which drive KPI attainment.  While working in an internal advisory and/or stakeholder management role is critical to this role, additional experience working in a consulting environment will be well-regarded.If this sounds like you we look forward to receiving your application.  Our Culture and BenefitsAs part of our IVE Care program, we invest significantly into employee wellbeing, diversity & inclusion, and workplace health & safety. This has helped us to remain the employer of choice across all sectors that we operate in and attract the best talent. Our environment is supportive and friendly. If you thrive on being challenged and want to grow professionally, this is a great opportunity.

About usWith more than 160 years of history, we are proud of our position in the community with more satisfied customers than any other Australian bank.  Every day, we work hard to bring our company purpose to life, feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it. 
We're more than just a bank with banking products. We change the lives of customers and communities. Commercial actions with heart!
Our time is now. We are challenging the status quo and we're excited about our future!
About the role
In this role you will be responsible for data solutions both in-cloud, on-premise, and hybrid cloud (AWS & GCP). You’ll be part of pioneering cloud services as the bank and growing our capability. It’s an exciting role as it will offer you diversity of work with involvement in multiple transformation projects across the bank such as customer facing platforms to regulatory reporting.
You’ll build strong relationships across the architecture practice, and with the teams that are developing new data solutions from concept through to production. You’ll join a team who pride themselves on providing first class services who do this through collaboration and supporting one another and have clarity of vision and good sense of direction.
Our community is a place to thrive in if you enjoy working in a changing environment and thinking of creative solutions.
Responsibilities include:

Providing consulting advice and review and perform impact assessment of initiatives/projects on the bank’s data solutions
Play a lead role in defining and governing enterprise data models
Contribute specialist Data architecture knowledge to inform strategy and plans.
Produce roadmaps and plans for establishment of new data platform technologies
Evaluate and document options for data technology selection
Design and develop Data solutions to support purpose-built data stores such as; analytic stores, data lakes, relational and transactional data stores, OLAP warehousing, unstructured data stores and event data stores.
Design highly scalable and elastic solutions in support of developing solutions for data acquisition, data storage, data recovery, data security, data resilience and data availability.
Contribute to architectural activities on initiatives and collaborate with stakeholders to convert requirements into key architectural decisions and solution architecture documentation.

About you

Experience with data modelling and data solutioning to deliver of large and complex solutions with the ability to influence stakeholders and decision making.
You’ll have a background with a complex data modelling and is able to provide architecture solutions. You’ll have excellent knowledge of data warehousing and reporting.
Strong know-how of cloud platform solutions and the related infrastructure and engineering pipelines. Practical experience with big data solutions in at least one major cloud environment such as AWS or GCP.
Experience with on-prem and cloud-based Data Warehouse solutions.
Experience with technologies such as: Spark, Kafka, MongoDB (or other NoSQL stores).
Experience with deployment of data workloads using CI/CD tooling (ideally Gitlab, Terraform and Ansible).

Why us?There's so much more to a career with Bendigo and Adelaide Bank than just banking. 
Get real benefits, work life balance and flexibility. You bring your brilliant mind and we’ll help you take your learning to the next level with on the job training and external development opportunities - we want you to shine. After all, YOU are the difference that makes us the better big bank.
At Bendigo and Adelaide Bank we believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.
Be quick to apply! Applications will be reviewed as they are received and may close before the listed closing date.
It is a condition of employment with the Bank that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless you have a medical contraindication or acute illness which prevents you from receiving the vaccine and you provide satisfactory evidence of this to the Bank.

Influence and monitor key elements of the development and deployment life cycles of the reporting solution


Build and develop business intelligence reporting and dashboard solutions


Distill large volumes of data, information and complex concepts


Provide timely reporting and actionable insights to support the decision making and growth across AIA Australia

Proven experience in data reporting and root cause analysis


Proficiency using Tableau dashboard development

Strong verbal and written communication skills


Enthusiasm towards working in a fast-paced and cross-functional team environment

At AIA, we’ve made a promise to help people live healthier, longer, better lives. And it starts with our own people.
